author: {'steamid': '76561198047393430', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 829, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1712237137}
review: Любимейшая стратегия школьных годов! Сколько сотен часов было наиграно в своё время уже и вспомнишь. При сравнении с более современными частями как рим 1 и медь 2 понял что стратегическая часть тут сделана лучше и даже сейчас играется очень интересно и бодро чего к сожалению не скажешь про тактику. Был бы очень рад какому нибудь ремастеру или римейку этой великолепной стратегии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002826085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 6043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 163, 'playtime_at_review': 6043, 'last_played': 1711280272}
review:
I took a year off of this game, but just came back and played for way longer than I thought....  I got destroyed, too.  In the past I did well, but now I have to relearn so much, even the basics.  I remember this whole learning experience, it's brutal.  My own troops wiping each other out, shooting each other in the back b/c they're shooting arrows uphill in terrible formation.  I know it's not a problem with the game b/c I was good last year, but I still can't help thinking to myself how stupid they are to be shooting each other.  I wish I never stopped playing Total War games, these next few hours are going to suck.

The AI is so much better than in Shogun 1, the previous Total War game.  Enormous improvement.  There's a lot of variety in the different empires and units too.  Expert mode in this game is really tough.  This might be the very best strategy series.

author: {'steamid': '76561199213369843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 262, 'playtime_at_review': 2667, 'last_played': 1712446501}

review:
IT WORKS!

I have spent many hours trying to make this game work on modern PC with no success in the past. But this Steam version is working almost FLAWLESSLY in the past 25 hours.
A brand new PC with Windows 11 and only hiccup I had was few crash-to-desktop instances in the beginning. I disabled autosaves and changed resolution to 1920-1080, which happens to be my native resolution. Not sure what helped, but had only smooth gameplay for 25 hours since.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000384995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2932, 'playtime_at_review': 2902, 'last_played': 1712461219}
review:
TL;DR version:  this game can be played completely chill as a board game-like TBS, 4 eras and mod support give it huge replay-ability, this Steam version runs great on Win10 and Win11 machines regardless of spec.

I've been playing and modding this game for over 20 years, and I'll probably be doing it for 20 more.  This Steam version is way better than the original CDs!

author: {'steamid': '76561199044489288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4060, 'last_played': 1706995724}
review: Desde que salió la serie Total War Shogun he sido fan de esta serie. Mi favorito siempre ha sido Medieval Total War. Volverlo a jugar gracias a Steam es maravilloso, aunque tiene errores de programación y algunos territorios no coinciden con sus identificadores, pero eso no es culpa del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561199035205547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 40599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40383, 'last_played': 1708613777}
review: Incredible game. The music and ambience is second to none, after all these years. The total lack of diplomacy and alliances makes the -always limited- AI shine and give the player a challenge, especially when the various factions gang up on you. Coupled with the XL mod, this game is IMO the best total war to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375029180', 'num_games_owned': 1496, 'num_reviews': 919, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1655713128}
review: Medieval: Total War é um clássico do gênero de estratégia que oferece uma imersão profunda na política, guerra e expansão de impérios na Idade Média. Os visuais, apesar de datados, capturam a atmosfera medieval de maneira autêntica. A jogabilidade é complexa e estratégica, combinando batalhas épicas em tempo real com a gestão detalhada de impérios em um mapa de campanha vasto. A variedade de facções e unidades oferece uma experiência diversificada a cada campanha. No entanto, a interface e os gráficos podem parecer desatualizados para os padrões modernos. Em resumo, Medieval: Total War é um marco do gênero, proporcionando uma experiência histórica rica e desafiadora para os entusiastas de estratégia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198222823320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 96661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17332, 'playtime_at_review': 9537, 'last_played': 1712475821}
review:
I have to change my review to positive. I WAS experiencing tons of crashes that were making me really pissed off. 

Now I'm very pleased because of a stupid fix. You have to go to the menu to put the game into a higher resolution. Its so stupid its brilliant, and should by this stage be an automatic process that has been applies to the game- the game can detect your graphics card and even lists it out to you in the menu after all. 

Its really fun I have thousands of hours in the CD-ROM version. Excellent strategy game, more of a chess game than a marching simulator. You will be attacked by a close ally for no reason at the worst time throwing your faction into civil war. Its great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068527419', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1705344813}
review:
One of my favourite strategy games. If you haven't tried it yet, i highly recommend playing Shogun Total War as well as this one.
For me the game seems to be running "too fast", it's due to the high refresh rate, if you have the same problem, you may want to set it up to =/-60  (even with 120/144Hz monitor) in your GPU settings, should do the trick.

author: {'steamid': '76561199215239224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1707009631}
review: cant get enough of it. of course there a lot of nostalgia and I haven't experienced the bugs others have. So take my recommendation with grain of salt. Many prefer this games predecessor, I for one love the original. especially the Anglo Saxon DLC. Starting off with West Saxons and trying to avoid the absolute slaughter that is the Danes when they start invading seriously is incredibly enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980527606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1222, 'last_played': 1704915976}
review:
20 часов долгих и кропотливых завоеваний всей карты. 
Вылеты при попытке сохраниться.
Постоянное появление Золотой Орды.
Долгое выстраивание правильной логистики с кораблями.
Куча возрождений убитых цивилизаций.
Рекрутинг всех под свою веру.

И чтобы что.

Чтобы когда осталось 10 областей для захвата, возродилась нация с 10 фул стак отрядами, бунты абсолютно во всех областях. И пр*еб всей карты.

И это б**ть на самом легком уровне игры.

О**енный релакс. Г*вно тупого г*вна. Не рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561199232418714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1377, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1712443907}
review: Good game, especially if you're new to TotalWar and/or cannot afford another just yet. The campaign works like an upgraded form of the board game Risk (though it does crash unless you raise the resolution. which isn't really a problem.) Though battles look funny when compared to later totalwars, they are quite fun and a little immersive in their own right. A great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054917775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 59, 'playtime_at_review': 10046, 'last_played': 1712334425}
review:
I love this game, have done for 30+ years. 
The artwork maps & colouring is(are?) what I like most.  I am red/green colour blind & I find i sometimes lose things in other games, but rarely in this.
I bought this game cheap - <$10 & am therefore not too pissed off WHEN IT CRASHES AT THE MOST INTERESTING POINT! especially as just now, when I escaped (the new ed. makes u escape b4 saving!) the only in-game saves are Auto & Quick-save (only available b4 a battle).
For those other long time Med1 players, u can no longer top up your units with mercenaries, nor can u meld mercenary units together, there are a number of new units & the ai isn't quite as dumb.
What used 2b a very stable game is no longer, but still lots of fun!

review:
I'd love to recommend this classic but alas, I cannot because it's intermittently unplayable. It has a glitch wherein you can't move your troops around the battlefield, which is obviously a HUGE part of the game.

I played the game for months and didn't have this problem. Returned to it a year or so later and... unplayable. Worse, numerous other people have had the same problem and there doesn't appear to be any solution found so...

author: {'steamid': '76561198030691980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6111, 'last_played': 1702695699}
review:
I was poking around looking for older games on another site when I thought hey, maybe Steam does some older Total War ports... came looking, and there it was. omg. Choirs of angels sang. I have missed Medieval Total War (the first one, the real one) since my old IBM laptop finally rolled over, jeez, fifteen years ago? Wow. I was installing it five minutes later.
Promised myself I would not review the game until I had played this version for a hundred hours or so. I've had it two weeks, now, and... Yes, that's right, I've played a hundred and one hours in two weeks. You don't understand. This is the real game: Total War the way it was supposed to be. 
I know, I know, some of the later games are engaging enough, and the campaign map has certainly improved over Medieval One's rather raw approach. But the battles. Rome, Medieval II, Empire, Rome II: The battles are just not Total War to me. Why? Because I played this one first, honey. 
It is certainly true that plenty of grade school players out there could kick my butt in any video game, but it is also true that making games accessible to a wider age range inevitably ends up dialing back the intensity. To me, the difference between the battle mode in the original Medieval Total War and all of the later TW games I have played is like the difference between Crash Bandicoot and PacMan. Or maybe between your mom's Canon DSLR and your dad's point and shoot off brand. Or maybe it's just this-- once the battle starts I am [b]in[/b] Medieval One as I have never been in any subsequent Total War offering I have played. Funny '90s graphics and all; I am in it for the kill.
It is not just the granularity of control, but the positioning, how much the terrain matters, the quality of the weapons, the armor, the general, the morale and fatigue level of the troops. These elements are there in later games, mostly, but the depth of play is simply not.
Now, this has cost me ten minutes of play time, and that's enough. I strongly recommend the game. Play it long enough to get past the old-timey look and fight an uphill match against a stronger opponent. You will think I said too little about how much fun this is.

 - Save after big battles. I have had some freezes, especially on exit to the system menu.
 - There's a pull-out menu under an arrow at the right of the minimap with auto- options for the onerous-to-manage campaign map. Hard to spot, and they don't tell you about it.
 - If what you want is to fight your way across the map, and to heck with the scheming and conniving, try the cheat code for money. It's out there.
 - If you finish a building and the unit it allows is still not in your training list, save and exit. It was there for me when I came back.

Good luck, and I hope you enjoy it. A thousand thanks to the toiling minions who ported this wonderful game into the future for us! I deeply appreciate the fine work. 8^)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968536252', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 2425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2425, 'last_played': 1540970319}
review:
Medieval: Total War is one of the first games in the Total War series, so I would only recommend it if you're playing for nostalgia or are curious about where things all started.

The game is over 20 years old now, so the graphics are not up to modern standards, and the controls and camera are very different to more modern Total War games.

The sequel, Medieval II: Total War, improves on it in almost every way, so I'd recommend going there if you'd like to play a strategy game set in medieval times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029345898', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1697928163}
review:
(réglez votre écran en résolution 1920x1080 avant de lancer le jeu pour avoir le plein écran)

Excellente suite à Shogun : Total War.

Plus de profondeur dans la diplomatie, unités bien plus diversifiées et donc batailles plus complexes.

Map énorme, meilleures graphismes, excellente bande son, possibilité de zoomer la caméra en bataille ou sur la carte de campagne.

Durée de vie bien plus longue que le premier opus aussi, ce M:TW va m'occuper pendant des centaines d'heures avant de passer au prochain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007251385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3063, 'last_played': 1696806769}
review: Classic totalwar. Very much board game style. Lacks in graphics but still a very immersive experience. Played it when it was released years ago and loved it. Just played it again recently and realised how enjoyable it still is, despite the lack of modern graphics. It is particularly noticeable in the battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279712292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1167, 'last_played': 1700532414}
review: this game is simple to play and as difficult as you want it to be. when it came it was cutting edge, state of the art graphics and in any computer i used back then it wouldn't work in battle mode but as tech has opened up this game is even better.  and the full expansion packs show the growth of the game from Total War to Total War Vikings to Total War 2. of the three the Vikings expansion pack has the best gameplay, of the total war era presented in those three games. this is not to include the Rome Total war series  which is an amazing collection  on its own.

review: The game that started global strategies for me a long ago. Still is better than Warhammer TW. Diplomacy, religion, economy, troops formations, weather... Weather! What other game do you know where handgunners and archers become nearly useless during rain? Only TW Medieval 2 can be claimed as better and the best. No poster-boys, no main character or main faction, only fair struggle of kings!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029194710', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1702712143}
review: An epic engagement of stories and saga retold. A reactive and diverse engine that, increases upon the Classic Shogun format. An unexploreable potential of variable heights and losses---  possibly to date as a games engine one that I have studied with the most. An auspicious and deep soundtrack that reflects the period in which the game is set. Both audio and visually stunning. An intrepid RTS adventure that allows to capture the (temporary) crowns of the Earth to which, setting the jewels upon the Crown; which is the Game itself. Pure visual and audio gold.~

review:
***UPDATE*** I found that fiddling with the resolution seems to help with the crashing. Game is great as long as you can get it to stop crashing.

Unfortunately, I can't recommend this fantastic game. As others have said, once you get so far in a campaign it will just continuously crash. I picked it up 90% off and thought it was worth a try, as I remember playing this game so much many years ago. It really is great, but the crashes in campaign make it not worth the time. You can still do the historical battles and custom battles just fine, without crashing, if that's your thing. 

It's a real shame, because as I played, I realized I didn't just like it for the nostalgia, but it actually is a really fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044414734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 531, 'playtime_at_review': 6612, 'last_played': 1712360115}
review:
Edit: Changing the screen resolution as recommended by other users in guides did fix my campaign map crashes, but it did not fix the battle map problems. I love this game. But i especially loved this game because it had both. Like other good titles, empire at war for example. Hard to recommend when a large part of the game doesnt work, but for some, it may still be worth it. I still play.
This game will begin to crash when you get to an advanced enough point to be throwing armies around of any considerable size. I even tried the viking scenario and found it to be the same, only a bit later. Still it takes all the fun out of the game to finally get rolling and be unable to play the game. I found the battles themselves to not function either as the frame rate is unplayable. I imagine their team could patch this but they choose not to. Dumb economics rather than character must be guiding their decisions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212608315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1706318715}
review:
Efsane klasik bir strateji oyunu! 
Oyun donuyosa Windows da ki eksik ve hatalı dosyalar yüzünden oluyormuş! 
DirektX9 filan yükleyin! 
"Medieval total war 1 oyundan atma sorunu" diye internette araştırın çözüme ulaşırsınız!
Windows da ki bazı dll. dosyaları eksik ve hatalı olabiliyor!
Bir de Oyun hata ayıklama diye programlar var onları araştırın! 

Bazen iç isyanlar çok başınızı ağrıtıyor! En genç ve yetenekli Pirensi Sultan yapmanız gerek! Eğer genç olursa 20 yaş filan hükmü de 40 yıl sürüyor ve sadakat de yüksek oluyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023230131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1677172397}
review:
This, along with Shogun 1, were the two games that started it all, and created a franchise legacy.
Now, however, the company has had a long history of lying to their fanbase, insulting their fanbase, engaging in immoral business practices, failing to properly patch all their horribly buggy games and charging unreasonable prices for low content, low quality DLCs.  They're no longer a good or even average company.

review: Some say this is the best installment of the Total War series, when we judge the game only by the tactical aspects on the battlefield and how they are represented in the game, as they should have been compared to how battles looked like in history. Later games went pretty hard on simplification of various aspects of the battlefield, especially after Medieval 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020225761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 2926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2926, 'last_played': 1669806749}
review:
Last time I played this Legend... right before release of Rome TW. That's quite a distant past. And the day I got RTW, I totally forgot about Medieval. Honestly, all my friends who played MTW also forgot about it, after they got Rome. Such a devastating effect it caused. Rome brought so mindblowing innovations, that there was no way back. 

And this is rather sad. MTW is a great game. Was back then. And still great even today. Just out of curiosity decided to check it not so long ago, and was impressed how good this game is. In terms of economy and diplomacy the game is rather simplistic, but within combat mechanics - much, [b]much[/b] deeper that in latest casual TW games. Such an attention to details, so many aspects to consider... I literally rediscovered this game again for myself.

Years ago, I got this game from one of my classmates. He was talking so much about it, that it was rather annoying. Medieval this... Medieval that. One day he even brought me a CD. It had so many scrathes that I didn't even expect it to work. I thought that maybe I won't even try and just tell him that the game didn't launch. But luckily, I did launched it. 

The very first impression was... weird. What the hell is this? A... a map?! Map - the game? With cardboard figurines? People play [b]this[/b] on PC? No way... Nevertheless, I gave it a try. I didn't even notice how I spent the rest of the day in MTW. I had no clue what I'm doing and what I have to do, but it was very exciting.

Later on I spent tons of time there. Finished numerous times for most fractions, even managed to unlock unplayable ones and fix some ingame bugs. Great times. And what and absolutely thrilling atmosphere here. True age of darkness. Even after all these years, main menu theme still gives me goosebumps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064824759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 79, 'playtime_at_review': 1924, 'last_played': 1711764438}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042192705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 30298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 128, 'playtime_at_review': 24457, 'last_played': 1712166095}
review: No co ja mogę powiedzieć, jedna z najlepszych gier w jakie mam przyjemność regularnie grać, ambient z mapy świata i muzyka z map bitewnych bije na głowę te z Medievala II, prosta do zrozumienia i wywołująca syndrom "jeszcze jednej tury" jak sławne Heroes'y. Rozgrywka na mapach bitewnych się nie zestarzała najlepiej w szczególności jeśli chodzi o oblężenia, są one wyraźnie ograniczone chociażby przez brak możliwości podstawowej jak mogłoby się wydawać, wysłania żołnierzy na mury, jednak manewrowanie wojskami na otwartym polu nadal sprawia mnóstwo frajdy. AI mimo że da się nauczyć po kilku rozgrywkach jego zachowań potrafi czasem zaskoczyć, gra się zwyczajnie nie nudzi

author: {'steamid': '76561198124849771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1395, 'last_played': 1703260515}
review:
Oldie but goldie. Or whatever. 

The second, and IMHO hands down the best entry in the entire TW series from back when visuals (sprite graphics anyone?) and flashy effects hadn't replaced the need to strategize and think in order to actually win battles on the tactical map. With a mod to prevent the AI factions from stuffing their rosters with crap, the battlefield AI is an opponent to be reckoned with and relentlessly exploits any tactical advantage it may get. Campaign map gameplay is really old-school and akin to risk, but again this helps the AI perform its task: being an opponent!
Coupled with homely if simple acoustics, one may easily forgive the various UI drawbacks that render the accurate management of a growing empire a hair-raising task.

Recommended for anyone who actually wants a TW [i]game[/i] in more than name only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198420886579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1704651542}
review:
Stary dobry medieval I. Ma jedne z najlepszych AI do tej pory. Świetne mechanizmy taktyczne jak i strategiczne i najlepszy system wycofania, przegrupowania armii podczas bitwy. Wystarczy dodać sobie wyobraźnią trochę detali. Do tego ogromne zróżnicowanie jednostek i najlepsze jest to, że nie ma balansu i o to chodzi. Bo przecież taka jest prawda, są kraje silniejsze i słabsze.  
Mimo opinii, że gra niewłaściwie działa na steam,wersja steam działa bardzo dobrze również i na nowych systemach operacyjnych, kartach graficznych czy procesorach, także bez obaw.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396064922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1019, 'playtime_at_review': 17475, 'last_played': 1712427513}
review:
This game is thoroughly enjoyable, when it decides to work. The game has a tendency to crash very often and it's now at the point where I quick save before I end the year as I always have the concern that it will suddenly crash and lose all progress since the last save.

It is however great to play when it work, the variety of mechanics such as different factions, religions, regions, troops and agents all work together nicely, and some of the events that reflect real points in history add a sense of historical context to everything that is especially fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156254614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2790, 'last_played': 1687162202}
review: This game is great and I used to have it on Disc, but time trashed it, so I got a new computer, and then I downloaded the Steam version. It seemed to be working fantastically, until I started going to wars with larger foes. Just as I clicked Automatically resolve battle (Also it happens when I click do it myself) but the game freezes, crashes, and returns me to the desktop. I have tried all the different ways to try and fix the issue, and none of them worked. So I have to say, Gold Edition of Midevil: Total War on Steam is a Total Failure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008194939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 84178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1155, 'playtime_at_review': 75440, 'last_played': 1712466190}
review:
This was the first Total war game I ever played and I love it, and still play it, to this day.      It is simple to learn, although as you get more experienced in the game, you realise that there are a lot of complexities within it that makes your game easier and more enjoyable.     Like learning that putting your most disloyal troops into battle definitely has a character building bonus.

To my way of thinking, once the Total War franchise got beyond Empire Total war, the games became too hard and had too many restrictions on game play.     The post Empire idea that the states you wanted to conquor were part of provinces held by other regimes, meant that every attempt to expand your empire meant that you automatically declared war on people you did not want to declare war on.   In Medieval 1, you could for the most part pick who you wanted to attack without some stronger opponent declaring war on you, and stretching your forces beyond breaking point.

author: {'steamid': '76561199052146339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2201, 'last_played': 1697814224}

author: {'steamid': '76561199111726749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3820, 'last_played': 1693487372}
review:
I was trying to play this game in the past but there was crashing problems or windows problems. This time I have it on Windows 10 3050, i5 on ASUS laptop and finally can finish my campaigns. 

As for crashes guide: 
 - outdated screen resolution may crush more often - use modern resolutions (scrolling may slow down tiny little bit)
 - the higher the difficulty level the higher chance of crashing (just more things happening around) - no solution, can finish any easy/normal campaign without single crash; but on hard+ I may have maybe 1h of game play at most
 - crash between menu and campaign, so if you did a lot of complex changes and don't want to loose it wait for a battle and quick save it, then try to save first thing after (if it crashes, start fresh and it should be ok) - saving often is good idea (similarly for using window key or switching between apps - just avoid to do it)
 - I don't use automatically tidy up armies options as it gives me better control over valour preservation (I know it tracks every single soldier anyway, but starting battles with optimal valour is important for initial advantage and turning battles quicker for your favour) - so the more complex your game play the higher chance of crush, some of my turns take 15-20 minutes to review all armies, calculate to shuffle units around for every florin of income, moving like a hundred+ units around constantly, etc. - this sometimes mean that I play 3-5 turns until there is a battle I can quick save, and then I restart the game from that save for another 3-5 turns (you could say it is annoying, but it takes less than a minute and it prevents random crash when I don't want it - it is the closes to normal game I do now on highest difficulty, and I still love it)
 - moving your army alongside crusade, instead of joining splits all units and empties crusade on next turn, if you touch any unit it will crash - just join the bloody crusade mate when almost reaches the target region :)
 - going into quantity is asking for trouble - try cost-effective middle units to delay too complex campaign, but playing with multiple stacks of cannon fodder can be interesting, this often forces AI to abandon provinces one after another, until they are cornered into one or two and you can send the elite :)

It is still very playable, I tend to use all kind of saves and sometimes looses some progress, but with some patience, giving my laptop rest if too hot and making brakes for study is very much enjoyable. 

I wish I could plan the vice and virtues in some way, but it is both edged sword (especially with agents), many events can go both ways, so on one side it does add depth, but at the same time you can do very little about it so you stick stats generated at recruitment and start to ignore any development after that, occasionally disband if things go terribly wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561199147804734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1687064240}
review: I'll begin this by saying that this game is as fun as you make it to be. Stop I know it sounds like I am the cross breeding result of a wise 60 year old man playing chess in the park, and that one fortune cookie you got that was a little too on the nose. But, despite the fact that I totally am, its true this game was made for an era where the words; quality, intuitive, and respectable graphics were more or less foreign concepts laughed at and somewhat feared. I have only played a few hours of this so far and plan to play many more, but it took me nearly 2 hours to learn the controls for this game (raised in the american school system, you know how it goes) but my brother and I had the time of our lives in that process as we tried to work janky controls around our " pfft its a zillion years old computers had like 4 buttons back then" mentalities. Long story short take your time, enjoy the game, and for the love of all play the campaign tutorial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306617983', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1711325568}
review:
Habe das Spiel schon vor Jahren gespielt, damals funktionierte alles einwandfrei und hat mir eine Menge Spaß gemacht; deshalb entschied ich mich es bei Steam neu zu kaufen.

Jetzt habe ich leider das Problem:
In einer späteren Phase des Spiels, wenn ich mit mehreren großen Armeen angreife, werden die Züge der KI und die Runde nicht mehr zu Ende berechnet, das Spiel stürzt dann ab.

Spiele mit niedriger Grafikauflösung und habe schon diverse Foren zu dem Thema durchsucht, aber leider noch keine Abhilfe leistende Lösung finden können; vielleicht kennt ja einer das Problem? :)

Ansonsten kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen, mir persönlich macht es Spaß, zumindest bis das Spiel im späteren Verlauf abschmiert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119774465', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1678399399}
review:
Consegui este juego porque Medieval 2: Total War es mi juego favorito de la saga, quería ver los orígenes y probar si me copaba.
Nope. En absoluto. 

La UI y navegación es vieja y no intuitiva.
El mapa de campaña no se entiende como en la secuela.
El combate es complicado de navegar entre unidades y posicionarlas.

Solo si lo jugaste antes y tiene ese factor nostalgia es donde puedo decirte: Si, compralo. Sino, ni te gastes, no es cómodo, es muy viejito y no es fun.

Acorde a mis estándares (basados en juegos relativamente modernos) no puedo recomendarlo a menos que seas un veterano del juego. Sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142261183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1621343848}
review:
Lo recordaba fantástico... y seguramente lo era.

Ya no. Han usado la mecánica como unos cimiento sólidos para crear otros juegos mucho mejores del mismo género.

Un bombazo del que hoy ya, sólo queda el humo.

Le eché muchísimas partidas en su día (fuera de Steam) y he intentado recuperar la ilusión que me hizo sentir antaño, pero se me ha quedado corto. 

Tal vez sea el momento de hacer un "reboot" total del título, a nivel técnico, gráfico y también, ampliar algo el contenido. De ser así, estoy casi seguro de que me volvería a ilusionar, pero por mucho que me duela admitirlo... es un juego del pasado.

¿A quien se lo recomendaría? Pues a gente que le gusten los juegos por turnos, que la acción intensa le aturulle, y que tenga un ordenador flojo/antiguo y que no pueda jugar a cosas mucho mejores. (es decir, a casi nadie)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035711284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1710864352}
review: I love medieval 1. It takes me back to my childhood. The music, the over the chessboard style, all the different cool titles. After reading the reviews for this game I thought, "Sure it crashes, but it won't happen to me. If it does, surely it won't be that bad, i'll figure it out" I was right for the first couple hours. A crash here, a crash there, no worries I'll restart it and do things a little differently so it wont crash again. Then boom. Something happens, can't change my playstyle this time, can't continue the save, everytime I try and move forward it crashes. I'm not upset I bought the game, but if you do, know it's gonna crash. It's gonna crash and it may get to the point after a few hours where it becomes unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452251290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1675310906}
review: This game is essentially identical to Shogun Total War, the 1st game in this series.  The controls, graphics, game resolutions are identical.  The character models might be a little different and the castle siege mechanics a little more advanced, with real catapults, and a different world location, but otherwise it is identical.  The game kept crashing the more I played until I reached a point still early in the game where it kept crashing everytime I loaded a screen.  In this case, its not even worth it even on sale, when its essentially identical to the game before it.  I would skip this in favor of Medieval Total War 2, or stick with Shogun Total war as its essentially the same game and seems to be more stable.

review:
This was my first Total War game almost 20 years ago and it changed gaming for me, it will always have a place in my heart and I only purchased it recently for the nostalgia.
If this is going to be your first Total war game its a great place to start but coming here after playing more recent TW games it will not be up to the standard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119117174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1671989584}
review:
The game never started on my computer and a message of error appeared saying that the graphics card could not support the game (It was silly because I have had many other more demanding games). I tried several times to play this game but it never worked. I asked for my money and they gave me my money back. 
I don't recommend to buy this version because I have this problem.
I played this game many years ago and it was a very cool game. I hope the developers could solve the problems. I would like to played it in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088174729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1678998520}
review: The game crashes regularly, and that's if you can even get it to actually start.  I have tried nearly every "fix" and it just doesn't want to work.  This is unfortunate, because I love this game.  I used to play it all the time in the early 2000's, but I guess new tech hates old tech.

review:
So the game is a lot of fun, its an old classic where I used to have this game on a CD and have probably played 20-30 times my steamhours. 

There are some semi-frequent crashes. Which might be due to age or my computer set up, Not frequent enough to break the game, however frequent enough to be annoying. 

I dont like that I have to use their luancher on what is literally a 20 year old game.  Which just gives me annother lunahcer I never use and have 0 want for.  And that is enough for a negative reveiw.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043313846', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 30840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24894, 'last_played': 1706168857}
review: Please help me, I can't stop. I have been playing this game for more than 15 years and I'm not even 30. I can think of no game that compares to the campaign in terms of its particularities and eccentricities. It is truly an underappreciated gem from a bygone era of Total War games. Even when I think I've truly "beaten" it, a little voice in the back of my skull goes "what if you played it again as every country but did it with slightly different settings this time" and the struggle begins anew. The main campaign theme lulls my girlfriend to sleep. I hear the sounds of marching from unit consolidation and babies crying from new heirs being born in my dreams. I have inadvertently memorized the resource density, chokepoints, and smart strategic plays for each specific region of the map. This truly is an age of darkness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016745946', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5974, 'last_played': 1710670837}
review:
LOVE this game. 20 year old game, and I still enjoy playing it. I prefer this and Rome Total War over any other entry in the franchise.

However.

It continually crashes. You will progress so far into a campaign, and then the game will crash on the AI turn. Saving/reloading/restarting does not fix it. It will always crash on the same AI turn.

Game is now broken. I mourn the loss, and warn anyone else not to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393895951', 'num_games_owned': 1507, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1664542106}
review:
[h1]游戏介绍[/h1]
《Medieval: Total War™ - Collection（中世纪：全面战争）》是一款由CREATIVE ASSEMBLY制作，SEGA发行的大策略回合制对战游戏。在这款游戏中，我们将可以体验到在中世纪国与国之间的你来我往。

[h1]游戏的体验[/h1]
本作作为一款2002年的游戏，在现在看起来其实并不是很好，其中不管是游戏的界面还是战斗中士兵的模型都是比较粗糙的，所以对画面要求较高的玩家，建议可以去玩他家最近的新作品（毕竟我就是从战锤系列过来的）。其次就是本作是没有汉化的，所以在玩的时候会相对困难一些，若你是一个英语苦手，那体验上肯定不是很好。下来玩法上，我个人觉得本游戏可以说是一个简化版的全战，也可以说是全战的雏形，实现了目前全战的最基本的玩法，这个设计在当时我觉得应该是非常亮眼的，即可以带领自己的派系来做想做的事情，甚至还有很宏大的对战场面，对于当时喜好战争题材游戏的玩家可谓吸引力十足，只可惜时间让技术力飞升，让本作已光芒不再，若你能接受它的问题则可以尝试一下。

[h1]游戏的总结[/h1]
总的来说，从目前全战的总体质量上看，我是不太推荐去游玩本作的，若你是怀旧党或者全战忠爱粉，则可以去体验一发。

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33626600]养老院评测[/url]
喜欢这篇评论，可顺手点个赞，让更多人方便看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198374006133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 172, 'playtime_at_review': 1730, 'last_played': 1712021201}
review:
CRASH FIX- Just match game screen resolution with PC screen resolution.
Too find resolution, go to SYSTEM, then under DISPLAY you'll find a # such as 1920 x 1080.
In game go to OPTIONS, then under VIDEO slide the nobs for strategy map and battle map 
over to the numbers that match your PC resolution, example, 1920 x 1080.

review: My favorite game to play very realistic especially when it comes to moral; the units don't fight to the death like other total war games. You could have a unit that can get charged by cavalry, elite or not and they could route. Other total war games units get charged, can fight a whole army despite being alone and could fight to the death (not realistic). This game is pure darkness, the campaign, game play and soundtrack is nothing but crude and dark. First found this game is 2007 and since I found it here to this day it's amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083567353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1657594680}
review:
I bought the game for nostalgic reasons because I had the game when it originally released. The game is still as fun as it was back then and is a lot like an advanced role playing game of Risk. On the downside, like many have already suggested about the game, once you get a couple hours into a campaign and have actually made good progression, the game starts to crash and will continue to do so even if you reload from the last save point. I only spent 2 dollars and had fun while it lasted but with as old as this game is, I don't expect any fixes or patches are likely coming so be warned this game tends to crash during campaigns without any fixing it.

Edited for a quick update: After not playing for a couple days, i reloaded the campaign that kept crashing on me and it actually let me finish the campaign. It still crashes once in a while, but it's playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013892414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1705083776}
review:
I bought MTW  game off steam as i played in the past and loved it, i  loaded it onto my pc then played this game for around an hour, then it crashed.so uninstalled it and reinstalled hoping that would remedy the problem, but it didnt.  So i installed it onto my laptop thinking that my pc was at fault. again the game crashed around an hour into playing it. so contacted Steam about the issue with the game. and the reply  i got from Steam was that they would not help me with the issues and will not reimburse me with a refund, as i had played the game over 2 hours, i informed them what i did ie playing it on both my pc and laptop to make sure  that  my pc and laptop was not the fault. i asked them that i would put the reimbursement money onto the MTW 2 game. so they would still be getting the reimbursement money back and more as MTW 2 costs a lot more than the original. they still said no.
  I am am disgusted with the customer care i recieved, as i have in the past bought quite a few games from them, and never complained once. and the only time i have ever complained i got  shot down, i would of had better luck talking to a wall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964476899', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1709930024}
review:
The game itself is great but it simply will not work on w10. Constant crashing and freezing makes the game unplayable which is a bummer.

Update: As of 27/12 - 2023 the game functions as it should. Maybe too early to give it 100% function rate but it seems to be working again. Will change to positve if it keeps working late game.

Update 2: I have been playing now for several hours both vanilla campaign and the XL-mod campaign. Also both vanilla and XL-mod is working in battles now aswell. However make sure you save alot because the game can still crash after end-turns and the save file can become corrupt. So as of 4/1-2024 im changing my review from not recommended to recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306304233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 14923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14923, 'last_played': 1652576076}
review: Great strategy game as any other of Total War Saga. It is tru that many aspects concerning the management of the turn based mode and real time battles have been polished in later games of the series, but anyway it is funny. I played the grand campaing with the germans in the early period and i've had loads of fun, the management of the empire is really complex and interesting as well. You must attend socio-economic affairs as foundation to develop a large military machinery that allows you to conquer more and more territory. The are unexpect events as the sudden appearing of long conquered factions, the surge of the golden army, catastrophes, ... As criticism, when a long ago terminated faction reappears, it do it with serveral armies equipped to the teeth, the amount of soldiers and weaponry that they did not have prevoiusly when you crushed them and the uqestion arise: How was possible to provide funds for such an expensive assortment of armies, you could think in other factions, but sometimes you are both the most powerful and richest nation, so ... maybe oriental civilizations that do not appear in the game? Ok, funny reasoning appart the game is great but for some minor crushes of the system and some pieces of the historic part

author: {'steamid': '76561198034565891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1666505758}
review:
Running Windows 10 or 11? DO NOT BUY THIS TITLE! Steam will pass you on to Sega Support. Sega will tell you the game was written before Windows 10 and will probably not work. Then they ask you to do what everyone that has ever tried getting this game to run, but without success. Eventually they just fall back to it a Windows Compatibility issue and there isn't anything they can do. So, unless you are planning on running this on an OLD WinXP/98 PC or through a VM, save your money!

I was finally able to get MTW1 to run with a legacy Windows 7 Home PC. However, it crashes any time there are more than about 3000 total men in a battle. Eventually, you are faced with nothing but territories with more than 3000 opposing men. You cannot attack or the game crashes. Conversely, if you are attacked with more than 3000 men (i.e. crusade or jihad), even evacuating the province before ending the turn will result in the game crashing. Heaven forbid you have a revolt in one of your territories with a couple thousand men. The game creates at least as many rebel troops as are currently stationed there, and boom game crashes yet again.

So, my original statement stands. This game should be withdrawn from sale. It's borderline theft on behalf of Sega (and Steam) to continue offering this title to anyone.

review:
I played this before Steam existed. 

The Nostalgia is great. As is Storming central Europe as the Danes with a viking horde. Holding territories from Norway to Rome and from Eastern Europe to Central France. All i na few turns.

The gameplay is basic and straight forward and turns are very quick. This is one of my favourite things. Later games have turns that are so slow, you get bored of playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561199022769697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1667870715}
review:
A sequência do aclamado Shogun: Total War, o Medieval: Total War o sucede se passando na Europa Medieval. Em poucas palavras ele aprimorou tudo contido em seu antecessor, com novos features para facções emergentes na campanha, possibilidade de rebelião dentro do seu reino; isso se caso um general que tenha lealdade baixa passe a ganhar muito poder e significância no seu reino - você também tem a opção se em caso de rebelião, lutar ao lado do rei ou do usurpador.

Possuindo vários cenários que cobrem cada período Medieval. "Early Period" como o nome já diz, começa do ano 1087 (após a morte de Guilherme, o Conquistador) quando os Turcos atacam o Império Bizantino, que no ano de 1095 mandaria o apelo ao Papa Urbano II, que desencadearia o período conhecido como, Cruzadas. O avanço muçulmano prossegue a todo vapor na Península Ibéria. Os reinos europeus como Inglaterra e França então ascendendo como poder emergente; a balança de poder estar equilibrada na Europa, não existe uma nação dominante. Contrapondo isso, no Oriente existe vários Emirados Islâmicos poderosos, controlando os lugares santos para os cristãos, eventualmente levaram há guerra a Europa. As unidades características do período, encontra-se os cavaleiros que são claramente a unidade de cavalaria mais poderosa da Europa. Nos reinos islâmicos há um mix de unidades leves e pesadas, com arqueiros e escaramuçadores, cavalaria leve rápida, ideal para grandes manobras de flanqueamento nas batalhas, porém é pouco armada [ESSA DESCRIÇÃO DE MAPA DE CAMPANHA E BATALHAS PERMANECEM AS MESMAS NOS OUTROS CENÁRIOS, MUDANDO APENAS ALGUNS PONTOS PARA CADA CAMPANHA, COMO A MUDANÇA DE PODER].
"High Period" se passa no Alto período da Idade Média, que é o de maior ascendência/proeminência período militar do Medievo. A campanha começa no ano de 1205, poucos anos após o fim da Terceira Cruzada, também conhecida como "Cruzadas dos Reis", certamente a mais famosa de todas; nela lutará os líderes cristãos, Ricardo Coração de Leão, Frederico Barbarossa, Imperador do Sacro Império Romano-Germânico. No lado muçulmano, Saladino. Seu desfecho foi Jerusalém ficando nas mãos islâmicas e a livre peregrinação de cristãos para Jerusalém não séria interrompida. No ano de 1230 a Horda Dourada (Mongóis) apareceram na campanha. O evento "Armas de Fogo" aparecerá 1260, possibilitando treinar unidades armadas e artilharia.
"Late Period", o período tardio começa no ano 1321. As Invasões Mongóis cessaram, o alto desenvolvimento de infraestruturada em algumas províncias é algo característico do período. A campanha termina do ano de 1453 (data histórica da Queda de Constantinopla e o fim da Idade Média). Unidades Piqueiras estão avalia para facções como as Italiana e o HRE (Holy Roman Empire).

Um ano após o lançamento do jogo original, em 2003 o Medieval: Total War ganhou uma expansão (assim como seu antecessor, Shogun) que acrescenta uma nova campanha sobre as Invasões Vikings, começando em 793 com Ragnar Lodbrok como personagem jogável para a facção viking, entre outros mais; contendo o mapa das Ilhas Britânicas e parte da Escandinávia, a expansão incluiu também a adesão de novos features como a religião pagã Viking, em contraste com a fé cristã.

Os pontos negativos estão na falta de historicidade, com facções genéricas criadas, como a Espanha que só passou a existir com o casamento Ibérico de Isabel e Fernando, unindo as coroas de Castela e Aragão; esse evento veio a ocorrer a metade do século XV. A falta de historicidade se segue nos próximos Total War's , sendo concertada apenas por meio dos mods.

Em suma, Medieval: Total War assim como seu predecessor Shogun, é mais um clássico consolidado que veio a dar origem ao aclamado e revolucionário Rome: Total War, que introduziria o 3D a franquia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140178497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1904, 'last_played': 1690079807}
review:
So, it's an old finicky game, but it is still fun and it is still playable.

However, it takes some work to keep the game from constantly CTD.

-Turn off autosave: Welcome to ctrl-s quicksave world.
-Turn off AI movements.
-Turn Battle Screen resolution AND Strategy Screen resolution to your desktop's native resolution before ending a turn when there is going to be a battle involving several full armies on a single side of the conflict.

There may be other tricks but following these, I was able to keep a fresh download and install mostly from CTD.

It is playable, but you really got to want it.

review: Si le das una oportunidad al juego, nada mas jueges una campaña te vas a dar cuenta que le da tres patadas al 2, a mi en lo personal los graficos tan simples me hacen gracia y me gustan, es cierto que al principio pierde mucho pero conforme le dediques horas no hacen falta ni guias (ademas que en español no hay), el juego tiene mecanicas complejas pero cuando las dominas son sencillas, no hay tanto mamoneo como en los modernos, las batallas se me hacen muy chulas y lo mas importante la diplomacia funciona NO COMO EN EL 2 que le papa es un CUCK que te excomulga como no hagas lo que quiera en todo momento (en algunos casos estas entre perder la partida o que te excomulgen) ademas tus aliados no es que NO TE ATACAN por la espalda si no que ademas te ayudan... INCLEIBLE.... en fin si no eres un pijotero que quieres graficos de ultima el juego te va a encantar... pero vamos que por lo que cuesta no esta de mas darle una oportunidad 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198126691374', 'num_games_owned': 1628, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1642472476}
review:
Puntos a favor del juego: 
-El diseño del mapa de campaña es uno de los mejores en los juegos más antiguos de Total War
-La variedad de unidades, aunque los ejércitos tengan cierta tendencia a lo clónico
-El Papa como el antagonista más psicopata y más díficil de erradicar de un Total War hasta la fecha
-Aragón y Sicilia jugables desde las fechas más antiguas en la campaña (en la versión cd, Aragón nunca era jugable, y Sicilia solo desde la etapa media)

En contra del juego:
-Las batallas. Lo que más le juega en contra a las batallas es el paso del tiempo, algo natural casi 20 años después del lanzamiento. Ya comparado con el Rome de 2004 hay un salto gigante, no solo en lo estético sino también en lo limitado de las formaciones y habilitadas de batalla. Mientras que el mapa de campaña mantiene su elegancia, las batallas se quedaron muy atrás en el tiempo.
-Las CTD. Lamentablemente CA nunca se ha tomado el trabajo de pulir el funcionamiento de este juego para sitemas operativos posteriores a windows XP; si hay que señalar que me ha funcionado mejor con w10 que con w7, pero sigue cerrandose inesperadamente

Más allá de esto, da sus horas de diversión aunque sea un poco extraño readaptarse al juego estando acostumbrado a los títulos más recientes en el tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276917304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1709579750}
review:
This game isn't without its bugs, most of the stemming from the Viking Invasion expansion, but saving often helps mitigate them and brings me back to this game often. I think the things that keep me playing this Total War more than the others is that it's streamlined, there isn't a single bit of fat on this game. Every game that followed it seemed to be needlessly bloated with a social presence to keep your population calm, or limited variety of units, constant income shortage, or overly complex or limited mercenary mechanics, or faction units whose stats were way too similar and created an air of redundancy and repetition, or there was always some other unnecessarily convoluted mechanic that got passed down the line to the next game. 

This game had none of that. It gave you a lot of variety without bombarding you with needlessly over saturated mechanics and cobbled together ideas that took forever to fit right in later Total War games. It's straightforward, and it's only hindrances stem from the age of the game itself. The keybindings need some customization, and the graphics are dated, but it also carries a classic air that makes it feel like the grandfather of the total war saga.

The world campaign is a vellum map spread over an oak table, with lulling atmospheric folk music playing in the background making you feel like you're planning your strategy in the tower of your castle with gameboard pieces that represent forces and agents. It couldn't be more beautifully simple, and it can be played at any pace you like. With the age of the game, it fits on a thumb drive and can be played for hours or moments. I've spent many days off on it, and I've spent a few moments before bed in my bathrobe nursing a glass of scotch while taking in the music and consigning millions of lives to death with a few simple clicks. 

This here, is a gentleman's war game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075664784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 31684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17945, 'last_played': 1707123201}
review:
Love this game, have played it for years even though I am more of a 4x, builder, survival game player. BUT I hate the combat field, 

- troops don't go where you say
- you can land a force of 100 armies that should win the day but they only fight 15 armies at a time.
- if an army gets defeated you have to wait for it to walk off  the field before you can send in another one
- ranged attackers run out of ammo and they have to leave the field before another can take it's place
- Leaving the field can take 10 minutes depending how deep into the field the troops are.

For those of you that love that sort of stuff this is the game for you. For those of you who find that sort of stuff tedious, like I do, you can do the battles like a chess game. Move your army icons into enemy territory on the world map, click the turn button when you are ready. When the battle comes up choose 'Automatically resolve' and you get a result. There are still tactics involved like an attack of peasant armies will not do well if they attack an army of Royal Knights making a win very unlikely. BUT then again they are cheap and if I send enough of them...... that's for you to find out.

author: {'steamid': '76561199113740089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1705468075}
review: 100% recomendado, veo muchos comentarios que dicen que corre muy mal la version de steam, a mi en lo personal me corre perfecto pero eso no significa que a ti tambien te pueda correr bien, compralo bajo tu propio riesgo de que no te corra, el juego es muy superior al medieval 2 en varios aspectos, el sistema de generales, edificaciones etc, que no te echen para atras los graficos del juego, es verdaderamente una joya escondida, aparte que las batallas tienen su toque, son faciles de entender pero complejas de dominar y no podemos olvidar esa estetica apocaliptica y oscura de la edad media que a mi parecer hace un mejor trabajo de ambiente que el medieval 2 y por ultimo recomendaria jugar los tutoriales, muy intuitivos, especialmente los tutoriales de campaña porque los vas a necesitar para entender las mecanicas (llevo como una hora jugada y nisiquiera se como montar soldados a los barcos)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065025632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1684077041}
review: The 2nd Game in the Total War series after Shogun Total War, Medieval is fantastic. The music is better than the 2nd Medieval, and the Unit Card artwork is better too. I've played this game on and off for years, on almost every computer I've ever owned. However, Medieval Total War 2 is a better game, almost perfect. If Medieval 2 had the music from the 1st Medieval, and the Civil Wars, and Re-established Factions feature of the 1st, then it would be perfect. And while the Viking Invasion for Medieval total war is fantastic, with Celts, Saxons, and Vikings at war in the British Isles, there's no Celtic faction for the main game... Medieval 2 rectify's this with adding Scotland. While I love Medieval Total War, and highly recommend it, I do love Medieval 2 far more. That being said, I usually still have both installed ready to play. Cheers.

This game manages to do almost every single decision that was also made in later total war game in a weird, extremely unconfortable way and has a lot of quirky systems which are too hard to get used to. defo not a terrible game but it comes hard for me to praise it

author: {'steamid': '76561198206161513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1637878662}
review:
Jeu assez qui date avec une qualité et un gameplay douteux. 
Mais le jeu fait quand même partie de la grande famille des "Total War" [...] 

Medieval: Total War est un jeu vidéo de stratégie au tour par tour et de tactique en temps réel développé par Creative Assembly et publié par Activision le 19 août 2002 en Amérique du Nord et à partir du 30 août en Europe. Le jeu est le second opus de la série des Total War et fait suite à Shogun: Total War dont il transpose le système de jeu en Europe, en Afrique du Nord et au Moyen-Orient pendant une période du Moyen   ge allant de 1087 à 1453. 

De plus, on voit quand même des évolutions depuis le tout premier jeu (Shogun total war) qui forgent les caractéristiques ont fondées les futurs jeux de la saga : Mélange des phases de stratégie au tour par tour, lors desquelles le joueur gère son empire province par province, et des phases d'affrontements tactiques se déroulant en temps réel dans un environnement en trois dimensions.

En résumé, il ne faut pas regarder ce jeu avec son gameplay ni sa qualité graphique mais le symbole qu'il est, pour la famille des Total war et ces fans.

review: While it shows its age and has many crashes (most can be fixed by changing the resolution), Medieval is still a great total war game and well worth playing. It's different enough from modern total war that you can definitely get a unique experience out of it. Unfortunately there are so many crashes that I can't recommend it as a vanilla game. Some of the great mods for the game deal with the crashes well, I'd still recommend the modded game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067138825', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1803, 'last_played': 1695495327}
review:
Needs quite a bit of tweaking to get it working, yet another old TW game affected by the curse of "Steam version" and Win10 sadly.
Once you get it working and running at 60fps it's a very solid and immersive game as the campaign design stays true to its board game design and plays well to its strengths while battles are satisfying, if you know what you're doing. 
It's arguably one of the deepest TW games in the series, kinda understandable where people were coming from when they got disappointed in Medieval 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259459624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1708104324}
review: I would never have thought this game was worth my time, but when I bought it for a pittance it surprised me with how much could be accomplished in this small engine. While simple, the game has features that are not in any newer games or even RTW, and I've always been a fan of simplicity and efficiency. Era campaigns as well thought out as these are very enjoyable and set this game apart from the other total wars. I would recommend this game to anyone who loves the campaign side of things and strategy on the aerial map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071124323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2771, 'last_played': 1639004011}
review:
Generally a good game, if you take into account when it was first released. As long as it works it is quiet enjoyable to build armies, gather territories and manage the economy to do all you need to do.
I would not recommend this for players, who are new to "Total War" games, since there is a definite lack of descriptions or help build into the game, that tells new players, what they should do.

Unfortunately the game often freezes and then crashes without saving or back-up. For me, at the moment of this review, this happens every 10 to 15 minutes of gameplay. I tried different changes with the settings, yet nothing seems to work. And it appears I am not the only one, who has this particular problem.

Therefore I can only recommend to NOT BUY THIS GAME, unless the massive issues with game-crashes are solved. As it is now, it is basically unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198877865752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3454, 'last_played': 1651876685}
review: In short I think its an amazing game, but I wish it explained more. The game, or more accurately a medieval war sim, adheres very strictly to realistic strategy. It takes into consideration elements such as moral, terrain, formation, surprise, politics, and many others to a painstaking degree of realism. Honestly, it adheres so closely to how individual soldiers feel so well that, as their commander, it can be extraordinarily frustrating (and humiliating) when  my far larger army almost guaranteed to win  loses because I lost too many soldiers in the beginning of the fight leading to low morale and being routed. Even without the battles, the political war on the board is now my favorite board game. The only complaint I really have is the lack of explanation. And since the game is largely overshadowed by it's sequel (haven't played yet) it is extremely difficult if not impossible to find any info online. If there is a place that has more info on the game please let me know!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023296991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1653638274}
review: FHD разрешение древний даижок игры не тянет, максимум 10-15 фпс в битвах, плюс вылетать начинает. При разрешении 1024х768 фпс приходит в норму, но армии становятся горсткой скачущих пикселей, и это боль. Максимум можно рассчитывать на стратегическую карту с авторассчетом, что всё же лучше, чем древний оригинал, который при запуске на десятке вылетает после второго стартового ролика.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190365028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1705193621}
review:
The game works great if you still have the CD. Steam broke the game so that you can't use cheats and any global campaign crashes after a certain number of turns. Be great if Steam fixed the damage they did. Or gave a crap.

UPDATE: As of August 2022, I've found that the cheats will now work. In some cases, it takes some tenacity. For instance ".viagra." will readily grant iron in all the provinces you currently possess. Following up with ".mefoundsomeau." will do the same for gold. Subsequent cheats for silver and copper will often require multiple periods (.) at the end before you hear the crowd-cheering noise that signals success. And sometimes, I found it helpful to... clear the slate, as it were, with a few taps on the tilde key (~).

I've also been able to complete several Single Player campaigns without any crashes.

So, currently, the game is playable with cheat functions restored - at least, the ones that I tried. If this is the result of a patch from Steam, they have my thanks. As a crunchy, middle-aged white dude, nostalgia is a big deal for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054162151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1661990380}
review:
Update: New computer with better game capability and Windows 11: I played for several hours - longer than previous crash on old computer, but crash still occurs when I attack. It seems to be about the same place as previous problems but I can't remember name of province and I'm not going to waste time trying it a third time. 

Original review: I have Windows 10. I merrily played several rounds until it started crashing. Every crash I've had has been change of turn with a large complex battle pending. It's not random. For any given situation a crash can't be avoided with some exceptions where I reload and simplified the battles. 

The result is, the game can't be played past a certain point. It's worthless.

I bought the game knowing this but hoping the crashes were random because I enjoyed the disc version on an older computer.

review: I would consider this the first truly good total war game. While certainly not perfect, and intensely frustrating in some ways, I find this game really endearing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005895285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1627488470}
review:
! Aucun crash du jeu pour ma part ! Au bout de plus de 6h de jeu, je pense définitivement que si les gens se mettaient à mettre à jour leur machine plutôt que de crier au crash, le jeu serait mieux noté. !

Je stoppe ma campagne en l'année 1263, car les calculs de fin de tour deviennent extrêmement longs... entre 15 et 30 secondes par tour ça finit par faire pas mal d'attente... aussi du fait que jouant les almohades et ayant prit un bout de terre sainte aux byzantins juste avant la première croisade, le roi de France à décidé de me rouler dessus T_T. Du coup je me retrouve acculé du céréniaque à l'arabie, bloqué dans un système de "je te prends 1 région, tu me la reprends après" qui n'a plus d'intérêt...

Les modèles des unités est amélioré par rapport à Shogun mais les champs de bataille sont inchangés.

Tout comme Shogun, la bande son est très répétitive mais MAGNIFIQUE !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986781352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1646808751}
review: Medieval: Total War transports Shogun: Total War’s gameplay features to the much more familiar European medieval battlefields, and adds a new touch to many of the game’s extraordinary features. The gameplay didn’t change much from Shogun: Total War, but now all factions have a different look and feel, and new aspects are added to the game, like the impact of religion and the issuing of Crusades and Jihads. Sieges, which were present in the prequel, but were not very developed, also have a much bigger role in this game. The graphics improved a lot too, including a better GUI for the player, and a more fluid engine for battles. The camera has also been tuned for a better, yet still not perfect use. Family trees and princesses add diplomatic options, agents and important units have virtues and vices that make each unique; in short, Shogun: Total War has been polished and recalibrated, making it a much better and much more addictive game. The Viking Invasion expansion adds a new map; while the main game is set in Europe and the Middle-East (and the northern parts of Africa), the expansion is set on a zoomed-in version of the British Islands, several hundreds of years prior to the main campaign. It adds new (fairly similar) factions to the game and sets the stage to conquer all of Britain. This game is hard to set aside, with all of its exquisite content. The definition of Great Sequel.

review: Just bought it for my new rig (RTX 3070, AMD Ryzen 7 3700X, etc) and was concerned whether or not the game would run since it's so old and I'm on Windows 10. The game booted right up with no problem, and before I knew what had happened it was 3 in the morning and I was neck deep in nostalgia. Note, the game may close if you try to Alt+Tab, but it runs just fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031928726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 122772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54820, 'last_played': 1701322221}
review:
The classic and best in the TW series IMO as it was forged by CA. It always was a little buggy / crashy and seems the port to steam hasn't resolved that for many users, but I have zero problems. Having said that, even on the original, ctrl+s before end turn is always sensible. Absolutely loved getting back into it. I have maybe 5k hours from CD plus the hours since I bought it on steam also and I'm still playing it regularly. That's after nearly 20 years. 

Check out the XL mod for huuuuge variety and additional units and factions. Literally endless replayability. The ability to actually control a unit fully may not be accurate for a general-in-command (then it doesn't claim you are a general) but makes for a great game, diving cavalry at lines of archers and withdrawing at the very last second when the enemy defends is great fun. 

It is well balanced as well with every faction being competitive on a level playing field. You just need tactics to beat western knights with a motley crew of turkic skirmishers or mongol horse archers, at least until you develop the mighty janissary or varangian guard. 

I also love the risk-style campaign map that provides a classic feel with more strategic considerations rather than having a tactical focus also at that level. In this title, tactics are on the battlefield, strategy is on the campaign map, and I think the split and balance of that works well. 

One of the best games ever released and currently available at $4 AU haha (summer sale price)

author: {'steamid': '76561198148067126', 'num_games_owned': 1790, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1624666348}
review:
I was interested in seeing the older Total War titles after playing some of the newer ones like Total War: Warhammer or Total War: Three Kingdoms, but it was not worth it in my opinion.

Before I even started playing this game, I knew that a lot of the quality-of-life improvements that is in the newer games would be missing and that is fine by me, I already expected as much. However, I can only talk a bit about the battles and not on the campaigns. The battles were fine, I first tried one of the historical campaigns and won while still having a bit of difficulty with the older control scheme, but the others I tried were also not that difficult to win.

Now to the reason I cannot comment on how the campaigns work. I started a campaign, looked a bit around the map, started to build some things before it froze and crashed. I tried multiple times, with different nations in different campaigns and it still crashed after only a couple seconds. You can’t play the campaign since it crashes on you.

If you still want to get this game, get it on sale. There are sales often for this, so you probably don’t need to wait to long for it. While there are problems with the game maybe you will get enjoyment out of it, or you just really like the battles from this series and only want to play them, I don’t know.

author: {'steamid': '76561199152224921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4945, 'last_played': 1695080068}
review:
This is one of the all-time best PC games i ever played, and i never even make it to the 3D battlefield which was surely intended as the primary feature. I play the main map and choose to auto-resolve all battles. Manage your kingdom's economy: florins in vs expenses. Balance upgrades: defense buildings vs money-makers. Form up armies and arrange them as tactics require, fend off the Vikings! Build fleets of ships or watch watch the invaders cause mayhem. Send agents to do special tasks: emissaries, spies, assassins, and clergy. Maybe the best turn-based game ever.

WARNING: i hope to figure this out and solve it some day, but this game does crash a LOT. In Viking era, i once played into the 10th century, but it usually crashes in early 9th. The old pre-Steam version (from the 1990s) did not have this problem. I still recommend the game, but brace for crash impact.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967252453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1653825493}
