author: {'steamid': '76561198062255687', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1547404863}
review:
i decided to write my opinion about "Medieval: Total War" , since i'm amazed by the "mixed/negative" criticism from the Steam community. 
Although an old game(2002) ,until today it remains my favourite "Total War" game ,since it's fast &complicated (*but not too much complicated in order not to get slow/boring) at the same time ,and has very easy/friendly interface ,thus it's incredibly addictive !!!.
Personally this is one of the best games i've ever played and since its release i've finished the "Grand Campaign-turn based-strategic map" with almost every faction and all the difficulty levels !!.----Great game !!!! 10/10 !!!!
P.S. : Important note : My review about this game refers ONLY to the turn-based strategic map of the game, since the real-time battles never interested me in "Total War" series ,so i always leave them to "auto-resolve".

author: {'steamid': '76561198870564758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1678144159}
review:
I played this game when it came out. It was good. HOWEVER!!!
Someone tampered with the game play. I was just attacked by 12 berserkers and 8 heavy viking units attacked up a steep hill after marching across the entire map, while being ambushed into the teeth of 60 charging axemen and 40 charging axe men coming out of the woods into their flank while 100 spearmen protected the flank and their 8 heavy infantry were yards behind. defeated all 200 of my men in 10 seconds losing not one man. I admit the setting is on hard. OH no. So all the units of the computer are gods. DIDNT know that. Someone tampered with the game and FIXED it I GUESS. It never could do that before. I played it over ten times. 
REDICULOUS RIP OFF!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021170926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 214, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1711747095}
review: Hra ve které sem utopil jako dítě hrozně moc hodin. Momentálně nově funguje i na W10 a když člověk hraje jen strategickou část a ne zastaralé bitvy, tak působí pořád skvěle. Osobně se mi od mala líbily ilustrace herního dění, mají v sobě něco neobvyklého. Mechanismy jsou jinak o dost jednodušší než v novějších hrách série a všechno jde ráz na ráz. Krom toho ji podle požadavků rozjede snad i moje pračka...

author: {'steamid': '76561198205351751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1944, 'last_played': 1689509952}
review: Beni Total War serisine başlatan ve bağlayan ve serinin hiçbir oyununun yerini alamayacağı yegâne oyun; Medieval: Total War. Bu oyunu hafta sonu arkadaşlarımızla oynar, hafta içi de oyunda yaptığımız savaşları anlatır; izlediğimiz strateji ile birbirimize örnek olur ve önümüzdeki hafta sonu kaldığımız yerden oynamaya devam ederdik. Evlerimizde toplanıp birbirimizin devletlerini yönetir, batmakta olan bir devleti müthiş bir gayretle kurtarır yahut yükselen bir devleti kendi ellerimizle çökertirdik. Arabic Battle 1 müziği zaten meşhurdur. Onunla cûşa gelir savaş meydânındaki orduya oturduğumuz yerden bağıra çağıra komut verirdik... :D Hülâsâ bu oyunu oynadıkça "Ağlarım hâtıra geldikçe gülüştüklerimiz" mısraı aklıma gelir. Güzel anılar böyle oyunların hayat suyu oluyor vesselam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075403106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 9953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1590109267}
review: Medieval is a very enjoyable game, but it isn't well suited for the casual gamer. The real-time tactical gameplay is light on spectacular unit abilities and heavy on realism, which might be too detail-oriented for some. Medieval has a lot of deep gameplay, but what's great is that you control how much of the complexity you digest. Medieval: Total War achieves that rare quality of having something for nearly all strategy gamers, and most will find a lot to like in it, for a very long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042112323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1487, 'last_played': 1707755051}
review:
старенькая игра, от которой кипяточил в нулевых.  у неё есть свои интересности:

+ несколько вариантов старта по времени
+ интересная страт карта и путешествия по ней
+ ИИ ставит себе задачей уничтожить игрока, редко давая ему поблажки (зависимо от сложности), что добавляет интерес
+ множество игровых фракций, со своими спец юнитами
+ вплетение в игру исторических событий (впрочем на сам процесс это практически не влияет)
+ можно играть за очки достижений  или простой резнёй
+ нацию можно разрушить через лояльность генералов (когда их преданность падает, в окошко битой стучится гражданская война). что лишь добавляет азарт
+ экономика. для её цветения нужно торговать с союзниками. захвати пару территорий, заключи альянсы и поднимай свою машину смерти

но есть и недостатки:

- непонятная политика (могут отказать в альянсе без видимых причин и при войне союзники чаще кинут, чем поддержат)
- чем шире империя, тем тяжелее её удерживать: если не уследить за восстаниями, они  будут отнимать столько же сил, сколько додавливание оставшихся фракций
- периодически перебитые нации возвращаются, чтобы снова получить люлей (утомляет)
- с определённого момента становится ясно, что уже никто не в силах тягаться с нами (например достаточно полкарты взять и  можно считать, что мир уже у ног игрока). будем считать, что это компенсируется периодическими восстаниями
- экономика. когда друзья поддержат врага, она придёт в упадок. ибо торговать можно токо с союзниками

повторюсь, игра классная. в итоге я не пожалел ни одной минуты, потраченной на неё.

распространённый баг  - на страт карте выкидвает при завершении хода.  самое распространённое  "лечение" - сменить расширение стратегической и боевой карты (у меня стоит  - 1600х1024). не спрашивайте как и почему - это работает. если продолжает выбивать - поиграйтесь с  настройками

author: {'steamid': '76561198021240237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1609357471}
review:
*HOW TO FIX CRASHING ISSUE* (for me anyway)

1. Go to video settings and change battle and campaign map resolutions to 1024 x 768.
2. If crashing in campaign (mine crashed at the transition from early to high period)  - turn off auto-save. This can be found in the wide arrow attached to the right side of the minimap.

Other things you can go include verifying the game files, reinstall etc.

I've gone over 240 turns and had it crash once. Once the fix was made, no more issues. The game is as it was when I first played it 17 years ago - a lot of fun and a different campaign dynamic with the risk style campaign map as opposed to the 3D environments later adopted by CA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198346924350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1632023398}
review:
Released in 2002, [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] is the second game in the [i]Total War[/i] series overall. Representing the pinnacle of the "first generation" of [i]Total War[/i] games, [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] has since been eclipsed by later entries in the series, beginning with its immediate successor, [i]Rome: Total War[/i]. That said, [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] is still definitely a game worth playing today, if you can overlook some of the more archaic elements of its appearance and design.

[i]Medieval: Total War[/i] puts the player in charge of a medieval kingdom in Europe or the Middle East with the goal of creating an empire using a mixture of military might, diplomacy, and subterfuge (the [i]Viking Invasion[/i] expansion, included with the base game, adds another campaign set during the Viking Age in Britain). Would-be conquerors must contend with a variety of threats, including rival factions, civil wars, natural disasters, the Crusades, the Mongol invasions, and the Black Death, as well as adapt to the coming of new technologies such as plate armor and cannons. The main thrust of the game, as its name implies, is warfare, played out using the [i]Total War[/i] series' signature real-time battle system.

The battle system in [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] is its main feature, and arguably the deepest and most nuanced part of the game. You as the commander of a medieval army must take into account many different factors, such as terrain, weather, fatigue and morale of your troops, and maneuvering in order to achieve victory. Furthermore, it is necessary to understand the strengths and weaknesses of the various troop types (ex. spearmen kill cavalry but are weak to swordsmen, axemen kill armored units but take heavy casualties due to low defense stats, etc.) The battle system in [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] does have a few flaws, namely issues with unit pathfinding and the obtuse way in which unit stats are presented (players are not given exact numerical values for things like armor and morale, only vague descriptors like "poor defense"), but the battle system of [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] is still a fun and challenging recreation of medieval warfare, and one that holds up quite favorably to those of modern games given its age.

The strategic campaign game, the other half of [i]Medieval: Total War[/i], has not aged quite as well. Unlike later games in the [i]Total War[/i] series, the campaign map in [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] is a 2D map made up of interlocking land and sea zones, rather than a seamless 3D map. While this design does make the game more strategic in some ways, such as by increasing the importance of natural geographic chokepoints such as the Alps or the English Channel, it can restrict the player's movement of their armies and agents to an annoying degree, and quickly becomes cluttered and hard to read. The systems underlying the campaign, such as economics and diplomacy, are reasonably complex and engaging, but are very simplistic in comparison to those of later [i]Total War[/i] titles (for example, diplomacy in [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] only has three options; "Allied," "Neutral," and "At War"). While the campaign portion of [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] was certainly impressive in its day, it has since been eclipsed by newer games, and can start to feel a bit simplistic once the player has gotten a good grasp of the basic systems of taxation, diplomacy, etc.

In terms of graphics and audio, [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] is again something of a mixed bag. Some of the game's graphical elements, particularly the campaign map and event pictures, look quite good even today, and do a fine job of immersing players in the medieval world (the campaign map, in particular, looks pleasantly similar to hand-drawn maps from the Renaissance). Other graphical elements, especially the real-time battles which feature 2d unit sprites on a 3d map, have clearly aged poorly, and can be muddy and ugly even on high detail settings. Audio-wise, [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] fares much better, with a soundtrack filled with horns, drums, and chanting that sets a suitably dark and bellicose tone for the game and remains my favorite [i]Total War[/i] soundtrack to this day. Although in-game sound effects can occasionally come across as over-the-top and cheesy, they are generally effective, and battles are a surprisingly realistic and disturbing cacophony of warcries, screaming horses, and clashing steel.

I have never played the online multiplayer portion of [i]Medieval: Total War[/i], so I cannot comment on this feature. I will say that the online server browser appears to have been removed from the Steam version of this game, so it would appear that the only way to play multiplayer with this game (battles only, no campaigns) is via LAN.

Though it has aged poorly in some respects, I would definitely recommend [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] to any fans of strategy games or of games set in the Middle Ages. Though this game's age will likely make it most appealing to die-hard [i]Total War[/i] fans or people who originally owned the game on disc years ago (like me), it is still a worthwhile investment for anyone looking for a unique medieval strategy experience.

EDIT: I have noticed multiple other reviews of this game criticizing it for supposedly being unplayably buggy, so I felt that I should briefly address this criticism. [i]Medieval: Total War[/i] does suffer from its fair share of bugs, namely issues with corrupted save files, and occasional CTDs when attempting to quit the game. However, I will say that in my experience these issues are fairly rare (once or twice roughly every 15-20 hours of play), and I feel that the game is still worth playing despite these issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041274071', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2894, 'last_played': 1660958503}
review:
This is one of my all-time favorite strategy games. Although not as complex as the more modern Total Wars, this game is fun, easy to pick up, and hard to put down. I highly recommend this game for anyone interested in Medieval history and warfare. Oh, and geography. I learned more geography in this game than I ever did in school.

Also, you know you’ve won when you have ships from the North Sea to the Black Sea. There’s nothing quite like shipping an army from Norway to Kiev in one turn…

author: {'steamid': '76561198054870134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1711962600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037045363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 68230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1443, 'playtime_at_review': 9210, 'last_played': 1712275867}
review: An all-time classic...and whilst it may now look a little dated compared to more modern rivals, I think that it still stands the test of time pretty well. Granted, there are some aspects that have been improved on over the Total War series, but this game is still plenty of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023600907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1705997028}
review:
This is a classic game which is one of the best of the Total War games. The area movement and simplistic systems actually focus attention on preparation and the puzzle-like resolution of a series of strategic problems, across a European landscape. At the moment the relaunch of this old game has a major problem with random crashes, so don't buy it until this is fixed.
Update: I kept trying different video settings in the strategic map view and now is running fine, so have set it up one notch from lowest and can now recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073209669', 'num_games_owned': 1018, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1558455033}
review:
This game is basically Shogun: Total War with improved diplomacy, different units and a changed setting (for more information look at my Shogun: Total War review).

Both of those games aren't great, but in this one cons (specifically random rebellions and factions emerging out of nowhere) outweighed the pros which made me quit this game very early. The fact that I played it almost right after finishing my adventure with Shogun might have affected it though, because those two games don't differ that much from each other from a gameplay perspective - at least for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035800214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1557951987}
review: I remember how much I wanted to get my hands on this game back when it was releashed. Unfortunately I have much higher standards regarding turn-based strategy and real-time tactical games, than I did back then so I am not able to recommend this old classic. Don't get me wrong, it's a good game. It's relatively straight-forward and easy to grasp. Discovering the differences between the factions is enjoyable and the pop-up messages relatively amusing. Graphics are pretty decent but the combat camera is incredibly awkward and restricted, which is the game's major downfall. That and combat is extremely slow. I almost never commanded the forces myself because I just didn't have patience for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045217305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5757, 'last_played': 1569963988}
review:
A game which back on disc I put hundreds of hours into, and for good reason. The campaign map is very atmospheric and is a good game in it's own right even if one were to autoresolve all battles, the soundtrack throughout the game is excellent. The map also captures the feeling of it being a board game of sorts. It is much more beautiful game than Shogun 1 and much more complex too, with rich unit and building rosters which add yet more decision-making. On hard difficulties the game can actually be genuinely hard, the AI is not stupid and knows when to fold rather than charging in like a crazed blood knight, a tendency it very much has in later games. A weak AI will instead employ delaying tactics, falling back from a region so as to buy time to gather a large host and repel the invader, it will also make good use of the siege mechanics to bog attackers down, to the point that unless a catholic player can set up a blitzkrieg assault which wipes out another catholic kingdom in one or two turns they will be forced to withdraw or risk the ire of the Pope, who will excommunicate you without hesitation and in doing so provide open invitations for all other catholic powers to pile onto you freely, even sending crusades. Unlike later games there are multiple possible start dates, which provide new challenges.

On to the battles, the 2d sprites are much better than the previous game and the AI is also improved. Deployment when attacking in a land battle practically does not exist unfortunately. Morale is very well balanced and feels realistic. If you have only played later games the UI will be a little confusing, especially since the move/attack button is left click rather than right. Cavalry soldiers can dismount during the deployment phase by right clicking on their unit icon, which can be very useful during sieges.

The modding community for this game is still somewhat active and several large scale overhauls exist, greatly improving replayability. Also to note, the complaints of the game not running on Windows 10 are unfounded, it DOES work so long as you just let it load without tabbing out or spam clicking until it reaches the main menu.

Unlike Shogun 1, I recommend this game on it's own merit rather than as a contrast to the later games or for the sake of it being the beginning of the series. Medieval 1 is a good game, if somewhat dated, definitely worth the price tag and more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272175250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1706829622}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030506402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 118867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1711211717}
review:
Version totalement instable et bugée.

Le plus scandaleux est de devoir racheter une autre version parce que Sega et W10 sont incapables de reconnaître un jeu CD acheté avant l'avènement de ce foutu Steam de merde avec ses jeux dématérialisés.

J'ai donc dû le racheter à contrecoeur, pensant à tort que le produit proposé serait stable et épuré de tout défaut. C'est en fait l'inverse et presque 10 euros pour une émulation pourrie d'un excellent jeu.

J'espère vraiment qu'un jour on arrêtera de nous prendre pour des vaches à lait parce que c'est le même scénario tous les dix ans tout au plus, même mes vieilles versions d'AOE ne fonctionnent plus alors qu'on nous propose des "mods de compatibilité" qui ne fonctionnent absolument jamais. Mort à Steam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059955576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1571490093}
review:
So simple compared to other total war games. In a couple of hours you can take over the world with autobattle or you can battle it out commanding your own armies for that sense of glory.

Armies and buildings are limited compared to other total war games so if you want a complex TWG look elsewhere but if you want some simple and easy world domination feels then this is the game.

My only problem with the game is that it doesn't like multiple displays on windows 10, 1920x1080 limit on resolution and you are unable to rebind the hotkeys for the world map view.

author: {'steamid': '76561198442678533', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1581592840}
review:
I can't believe after 17 years this game is still around. 
It shows you how much fun games used to be. 
I just downloaded it a few days ago feeling nostalgic and I'm glad I did. 
Nice graphics and battles in real time. If you're a history buff this game is for you. 
It's micro management game too. 
I hope you like it as much as I do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065134951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6799, 'last_played': 1568376615}
review:
Oyun istediği ücreti hak ediyor. Eğer fiyat-performans arayan bir strateji oyuncusuysanız ya da nostalji yapmak istiyorsanız bu oyunu kütüphanenize ekleyebilirsiniz. Oyun haritasında aktif hareketin henüz olmaması ve diplomatik ilişkilerin çok aktif olmaması (Empire Total War vb. olan gelişmiş diplomasi ekranının olmaması) ve oyunun en zor (very hard) seçeneğinde en zor krallık (katalan krallığı) ile bile oynasanız oyuna kolaylıkla adapte olarak başarılı bir ülke yöneticisi olabilirsiniz. Fakat; zor seviyorsanız size daha yeni Total War oyunlarına yönelmenizi öneririm.

Oyundaki ülkelerin çeşitliliği ve her milleti seçebilmemiz güzel olmuş.
Birlik çeşitliliği bir tık zayıf olmuş fakat oyundan sıkılmanıza sebep olmuyor. Dönemi için konuşacak olursak çok çeşitli olduğunu da söyleyebiliriz hatta.
Oyunun Campaign süresi gayet tatmin edici.
Oyunun world campaign'İ dışında bir de British Campaign'i var. Ki oyunun içinde bu bize bir DLC sunuyor. Bu da bir artı puandır.
Oyuna puanım bugünün şartlarında grafiklerinin eskimiş olması ama yine de müziklerinin oldukça keyifli olduğunu da hesaba katarsak 6/10 
Kendi dönemi içindeyse oyuna puanım 8/10 
Bu oyuna Bronz madalya veriyorum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048347273', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 391, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1552862971}
review:
[quote=Setna] Başlamadan önce diğer incelemelerimi görebilmek için [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36579661-Setna/] buraya[/url] tıklayın. [/quote]

Medieval: Total War ile Total War serisi büyüklerin ligine giriş yapıyor. İlk oyunda oynadığımız orta ölçekli Japonya haritası yerine Avrupa/Batı Asya/Kuzey Afrika bölgelerinin dahil olduğu dev bir haritaya geçiş yapıyoruz. Benim favorilerimden biridir bu oyun. Küçükken sanırım en çok oynadığım 2-3 oyundan biriydi. Sağı solu fethedip babama anlattığımı hatırlıyorum :)

Oyun adından da anlaşılacağı üzere orta çağda geçiyor. Türkler Anadolu'ya yeni girmiş, Bizans iyice güçten düşmüş. Bizde bu tarihlerde istediğimiz bir ülkeyi seçerek oyuna başlıyoruz. Bu arada seçimi yaparken oyunun kazanma koşulunu da belirliyoruz. Tüm haritayı fethederek mi kazanacağız yoksa belirli bölgeleri mi bunu seçiyoruz.

İlk oyuna göre kale savaşları çok daha kaliteli ve gerçekten kale var bu sefer. İlk oyunda 1. seviyedeki bir kaleye saldırdığımızda içinde 2 manga asker olan tahtadan kara bir duvar oluyordu ama artık böyle değil. Kalelerin içi gerçekten dolu ve gerçekten kale şeklindeler. Hatta bununla birlikte saldırılarda yıkılan ve hasar gören binaların mekaniği de değişmiş oldu. Önceden rastgele olarak binalar hasar alırken bu sefer saldırı sırasında hasar verip vermemenize bağlı olarak değişiyor. Daha doğru ve gerçekçi anlayacağınız. Kamerayı yönlendirmekte artık çok daha kolay ve rahat. İlk oyunda sorun yaşayan kişiler bu oyunda baya rahatlayacaktır eminim ki. Birim çeşitliliği de ciddi oranda artmış. 10 farklı birim değil artık çok daha fazlası var ve her ülkenin kendine has bolca birimi mevcut. Bu kadar kara birliğine ekstra olarak bir de gemiler dahil edilmiş ee daha ne olsun işte. Çok güzel bir gelişim yakalamışlar açıkçası. 

Oyunun grafikleri ilk oyuna göre çok ciddi şekilde gelişmiş. Birçok görsel efekt eklenip oyunu daha iyi bir hale getirmişler. He tabi hala çok eski ama ilk oyundaki karakterler bir ayrı kötüydü. 

Demem o ki Total War oynayan biriyseniz mutlaka bu oyunu da denemelisiniz. Biraz eski belki ama emin olun klasikler çok keyifli oluyor. Ben aldım baya da oynadım eski günleri hatırladım. Şimdi Steam kütüphanemin raflarında duruyor. Belki yakında yine canım çeker indirir oynarım. 

Medieval: Total War ne kadar eski de olsa çok keyifli. Total War serisinin reklamını yapan serinin büyükler ligine girmesini sağlayan bir oyundur. Her Total War oyuncusunun denemesi gerektiğini düşünüyorum. 72SP

author: {'steamid': '76561198136642089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1651395551}
review:
Es un grandioso juego, avanzado para su época. He disfrutado jugándolo tanto o más como hace 15 años. 

Pero si tienes Windowns 7 o superior es una putada, porque seguramente no te funcionará. Aunque tiene fácil solución.

Yo he seguido paso a paso las guías para poder hacerlo correr sin que crashee y tras bajarme parches y poner todas las configuraciones posibles seguía con el problema del crash. La única solución real que he encontrado es utilizando la tarjeta gráfica integrada de la placa base.

¿Cómo hago eso? basta con desactivar el controlador de la tarjeta gráfica y reiniciar. Y tras hacer eso e iniciar desde la carpeta y no desde steam he podido jugar durante horas sin que crashee.

En windowns 10: buscar "administrador de dispositivos" > adaptarores de pantalla > lo desabilitaís y a correr.

Más de 5 horas para buscar solución, espero que podáis jugar como yo sin problemas ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1549900024}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

MEDIEVAL: Total War is a game developed by The Creative Assembly and published by SEGA and forms part of the Total War series

The game offers some pleasant graphics and really vibrant colours, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nonetheless

MEDIEVAL: Total War overall, however, is a fun game to play, yet sometimes flawed, but is a great grand strategy game to play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197995033878', 'num_games_owned': 1436, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1549635180}
review:
I just want to add to all of the reviews saying that I was unable to get this game to run for more than a few minutes on my hardware without crashing. Real shame, as I love the other (older) Total War games and it looks like it would be lots of fun. So, for what it's worth I'm pretty sure I would recommend the game itself, but this just seems to be a very low effort port spat out by CA to make some pocket money on one of their games that had been out of easy circulation for a while.

I'm aware that getting old games like this to run reliably on new hardware is no easy task, but it really feels like CA didn't even try. Seems like every time I give modern CA a chance and buy one of their games it lets me down somehow nowadays, but that's a larger issue I have with them.

I've attempted every permutation of resolution settings, Graphics Card settings and compatability settings I could find recommended online but, alas, none seemed to do the trick for me. While my play time is only 0.1 hours, I must have easily spent an hour trying to get it working, and there comes a certain point when really CA should be paying me for the work I'm putting into trying to get their game to work on my hardware.

Maybe I'm just an idiot and I missed the one setting that would magically get it to work for me, and maybe you yourself will be lucky and the game will run without issue for you, or after changing the resolution settings as seems to be the most common recommendation that has worked for people. But I would say that when buying this don't expect it to just work without any tinkering with the settings even in the best case scenario. And be ready to ask for a steam refund like myself as there seems to be a chance that nothing you do will help depending on your computer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961622994', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1701927452}
review:
Best Total War game of all time. I played around 300 hours before it was available on Steam so ignore my low playtime.

Very outdated graphics but incredible gameplay with limitless replay value. The AI is superb and unpredictable, I once saw Aragon (a tiny power that starts with 1 province) take over half the map before I finally stopped them with an all out war that I won by the skin of my teeth. All my best armies were decimated but the replacements got the job done.

Another game I sent my 5 sons into a battle and they were all killed, despite me winning the battle. I felt a real sense of personal loss with my 5 fictitious sons killed, I forget all their names but it was devastating lol.

This development team needs to start work on Medieval 3 immediately. Ignore the bad reviews from the noobs who can’t figure out how to load this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019514371', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1551213103}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053255347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1602592644}
review:
Dla mnie stary doby Medieval I, kupiłem ze względu na sentyment i chęć powrotu do serii.
U mnie chodzi bez problemów na win7. 
+ładna klasyczna grafika, choć starzejąca się szybciej niż Heroes 3 . 17 lat to naprawdę dużo dla rozwoju technicznego i ewolucji gier.
+śliczna nastrojowa muzyka
+ustawienie rozdzielczości na HD i wyżej, co w wersji z 2002 jest niemożliwe bez modu
+działa na tablecie i chyba każdej współczesnej konfiguracji
+poprawnie przedstawiona kolizja jednostek i walka (czego brakuje w Warhammer 2)

-bugi, czasem wywala do pulpitu, twórcy mieli dość czasu aby naprawić wszystkie błędy crasów od 2002 roku, naprawdę.
-problemy z działaniem na najnowszych systemach (opinie wielu innych użytkowników), sugeruje iż twórcy nie zmienili w sposób istotny kodu gry, dodali a czasem i odjęli kilka opcji (np. rozdzielczość, spolszczenie), a powinni wspierać ten produkt bo sprzedają Go nadal.
-można było dodać usprawnienia i optymalizacje.
-brak języka polskiego jest dla niektórych barierą (co ciekawe wersje  pudełkowe przeznaczone na rynek Polski z 2002 roku posiadał nasz ojczysty język). 
-można było dodać lepszej jakości tekstury, tekst, dodać muzykę w ten sposób odświeżyć produkt nikłym nakładem finansowym a tym samym wydłużyć jego żywotność.
-grafika dla niektórych graczy nie znających możliwości blaszaków tamtych czasów może wydawać się archaiczna i brzydka.
Podsumowując. Grę polecam tym ,którzy przeczytali moją recenzje i stwierdzili że pomimo niedociągnięć od 2002, to warto kupić produkt. Ja sam kupiłem i nie żałuje, ale jeśli masz 12-24 lat i nie znasz języka angielskiego to odradzam.  Mam nadzieję że w końcu twórcy przeznaczą minimalny nakład pracy i usprawnią tytuł, wtedy nie widzę problemu aby wydać te 9zł w promocji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186533471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1707943236}
review:
Dziękuje, dziękuję i jeszcze raz dziękuję. Myślałem, zę już w to nie zagram, bo na ósemce wersja pudełkowa nie działa. Gra stara, ale zdecydowanie warto. Prostszej mechaiki już być nie może, klimat średniowiecza wspaniały, muzyczka jedna z najleszych w grach, AI nie za mądre jak zwykle, ale przynajmniej ma wprowadzone jakieś cele i nie wypowiada wojny frakcji z drugiej strony mapy bez powodu. Systemu bitewnego lepszego niż ten ze starszych Total Warów nie znam.

Na minus niestety problemy techniczne: gra potrafi się wieszać (błąd Windowsa w niespodziewanym momencie), pokazuje, że sterowniki nieaktualne, ale nie pokazuje, jakie i skąd pobrać. Również brak języka polskiego, a przecież był w złotej edycji pudełkowej.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053508971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 28837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4613, 'last_played': 1704431590}
review:
Played this religiously back in 2003-2004. It's nice to have one finally working for windows 10. Can't speak comparatively for the other Total War titles as I have very little playtime on them, but I still have a lot of fun with this game.

Few things to note though: It doesn't play like a normal RTS outside of the actual army battles. The campaign board, a huge part of the game, plays more like the game Risk or Chess. I believe the newer TW titles have much more interactive campaign boards too. If that's a turnoff, then I'd look elsewhere.

Also despite "working" on windows 10, the game crashes at least 4-5 times per campaign. The crashing almost always happens when you end turn or start battles. Sometimes while tabbing out as well. Ctrl-S(ave) often, especially after a large battle or after you've moved the pieces around/assigned titles/done anything else that consumes a lot of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263263474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1616807026}
review:
🇩🇪 DEUTSCH 🇩🇪

Mein erstes Total War, 15, 16 Jahre ist es her... und es ist noch immer großartig!

+ charmante Pixelkriege

Mich faszinieren die Einheiten hier viel mehr als "lebensechte Gesichter" in neuen Teilen, die bloß herumspacken. Das Interface ist klar und verständlich, die Kampagnenkarte erinnert an ein Brettspiel. Es ist simpel, aber es wirkt.

+ eine bessere deutsche Übersetzung als Med 2

Ja, wirklich! 😅🇩🇪 Außerdem sind die Hintergrundtexte und strategischen Empfehlungen in der Fraktionsauswahl großartig. So detailliert waren sie danach nie mehr.

+ die beste Hintergrundmusik der gesamten Reihe

Der Soundtrack von Rome 1 und Med 2 ist schon gut, aber der von Med 1 übertrifft beide bei weitem. Er trifft in der Schlacht stets die richtige Stimmung und die Tracks des Menüs und der Kampagnenkarte müssten sich mittlerweile in mein Ohr gefressen haben.

+ einfache Mechaniken

Die Spielmechaniken sind leicht verständlich, einfach zu lernen und erlauben viele Experimente. Keine Taktik ist perfekt - oder falsch. Und keine Armee ist "meta".

+ eine Kombination aus verschieden Gebäuden ist erforderlich, um bestimmte Einheiten auszubilden

Das ist bloß logisch! Dieser eine Punkt, der vereinfacht wurde, fehlt mir in jedem folgenden Spiel der Serie.

+ die Fraktionen scheinen geradezu für den Mehrspielermodus optimiert zu sein

Eine Schlacht in Med 1 braucht keine Regeln. Jede Seite ist spielbar, jeder Seite kannst du einen eigenen Charakter geben.

+ ganz viel Nostalgie... 🙈😁

Selbsterklärend! 😊😍

+ es ist tatsächlich ein Total War

Ritter in strahlenden Rüstungen! Kämpfe mit tausenden kleinen, verpixelten Männchen! Du kannst einen Wikinger spielen oder einen Kreuzfahrer! Der Deutsche Orden ist auch dabei! Das hat mich schon mit 8, 9 Jahren fasziniert und tut es noch immer. ❤

- schwierig zum Laufen zu kriegen
- schwierig, Mitspieler für Onlinegefechte zu finden 😥😓

FAZIT:

Med 1 brauch sich vor seinen "großen Brüdern" Med 2 und Rome 1 nicht zu verstecken, es ist ein Spiel, das leider mit der Zeit vergessen zu worden scheint, unterstrichen von technischen Schwierigkeiten und eines schlechten Zugangs zum Mehrspieler heutzutage. Hol' dir

TUNNGLE

und mach' eine Diskussion im Communityhub auf, in der du nach Mitspielern fragst. Du wirst es nicht bereuen.

11/10,

weil es in einer Liga wie Med 2 und Rome 1 spielt, in der keine Bewertung mehr angemessen sein kann.

🇺🇸 ENGLISH 🇬🇧

My 1st Total War, it's been 15, 16 years... and it's still amazing!

+ appealing pixel wars

Those simple graphics fascinate me much more than any "realistic faces" that bug out in newer titles. The interface is easy to understand, the campaign map reminds me of a cardboard game. It's simple, but it works.

+ a better German translation than Med 2

Yes, I'm serious! Also these info texts about every faction and suggested strategies in the faction selection menu are just great! They have never been as good ever since.

+ the best soundtrack of the series

Rome 1's and Med 2's soundtrack may be awesome, but Med 1 supasses both of them by far. It always fits your mood in a battle and those menu and campaign map tracks must have burned themselves into my ear by now.

+ easy mechanics

The game mechanics are easy to understand, easy to learn and allow for many experiments. No strategy is perfect - or wrong. And no army is "meta".

+ a combination of different buildings is required to recruit certain units

That's just logical! I miss this one thing that got streamlined in every other title.

+ the factions seem to have been optimized for multiplayer battles

An MP battle of Med 1 doesn't need rules. Every faction is playable, every faction may have its own character.

+ a whole lot of nostalgia...

Self-explanatory!

+ it's indeed a "Total War"

Knights in shining armour! Battles with 1000s of smol, pixelated combattants! You may play as a Viking or Crusader! The Teutonic Order is in this, too! This amazed me when I was 8, 9 years old and still does so today.

- hard to make it work
- hard to find fellow players for online MP battles

CONCLUSION:

Med 1 doesn't need to hide behind its "big brothers" Med 2 and Rome 1, it's a game that unfortunately seems to have gotten lost in time and forgotten, underlined by technical issues and those difficulties to connect to its online MP. Get

TUNNGLE

and start a discussion in its Community Hub asking for opponents. You won't regret it.

11/10,

because it plays in the same league like Med 2 and Rome 1 in which no score is appropriate anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010689524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9261, 'last_played': 1547033675}
review:
Первый Medieval на уровне сложности кампании Expert с самой трудной фракцией (кампания позднего периода за Арагон) является самой сложной игрой серии Total War за всю ее историю, - этим и интересен для опытных игроков и любителей серии даже в наше время. 
Резкие и труднопрогнозируемые изменения лояльности провинций присутствовали и в первом Сегуне, но тут данный фактор усугубляется возможностью папского отлучения, чрезвычайно ограниченными возможностями для расширения на первом этапе кампании, в значительной степени рандомным восстановлением уничтоженных фракций с несколькими стеками войск и проч. 
В то же время, в отличие от, например, первого RTW, где были непроходные варианты кампании (в частности, короткая кампания за бриттов при максимальном размере отряда не проходится честным образом на вх/вх из-за стартовых условий Египта и Селевкидов), в первом MTW все, даже самые сложные кампании могут быть успешно пройдены при должном уровне подготовки и знания механики игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994344129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1772, 'last_played': 1663582998}
review:
Bardzo przyjemna gra strategiczna z elementami taktycznymi. Symulacja zarządzania królestwem? Jest. Sojusze i dyplomacja? Jest. Bitwy? Są!

W porównaniu do pierwowzoru (Shogun: Total War) dostajemy większą mapę, więcej dostępnych frakcji, i wszystko w znajomych klimatach średniowiecznej Europy, okraszonej historycznymi wydarzeniami (najazdy Mongołów, krucjaty, wydarzenia mające wpływ na lojalność prowincji). Brakuje animacji związanych z uzywaniem zabójców do eliminowania wrażych generałów, księżniczek i agentów - jednakże nie jest to coś co ma istotny wpływ na rozgrywkę.

Szkoda tylko, że gra niedostępna w polskiej wersji językowej (była kiedyś wydana z pełnym dubbingiem i napisami, ale przypuszczam, że ciężko teraz dojść kto ma prawa do tłumaczenia, więc raczej na steamie się nie pojawi).

author: {'steamid': '76561198871831516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 43355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4328, 'last_played': 1691112178}
review: Love this game, was excited to find it on Steam after I played it years ago. But it won't work on my new laptop (graphics card not supported), and crashes on my old one whenever a big battle happens. Fortunately, I found a fix: change the visual campaign map settings to something just under the highest resolution. Change the battle resolution to the lowest (if that's not the default) and problem solved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006631796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1706869897}
review:
This is a great game, and even decades after release it still offers many positive emotions and replayability. Especially if you are quite sensitive and have good imagination.
While newer Total War games focus on graphics, drawing every little detail in real time for you, the older ones leave a lot of space for fantasies. The game has charming immersion which fully resembles the era mentioned in the title. Medieval: Total War offers a true medieval experience, unforgiving, grim and epic. Everything including tough tension battles, art style, sounds, voice acting, music, paper stratmap - it all works for that goal. You'll feel medieval timeframe to the bones. Amazing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073550762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1544787822}
review: Replaying the orginal Total war games, on a nostalgia trip. REGARDING THE CRASHING !!! Yes, this did happen to me during camapaign, especially during larger battles and significant events. What I did was to go into settings > video > change from 800x600 ( which ever the default is), and make the resolution higher, at least half way. This seemed to work, as I was about to start a large battle, kept crashing, changed to higher res, worked a treat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173746634', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9390, 'last_played': 1701933208}
review: This game is very simple, but this is not a downside. Its is very fun once you learn how to play its simple mechanics. The battles are easy to run, they are verying in difficulty, and very fun. I do not know about other people's experiences, but I got addicted to this game on muliple occasions. There are many upsides (many listed), but there are few downsides. The biggest by far is the gamebreaking glitch of crashing. This problem fortinatly has been fixed a long time ago, you simply have to change the resolution to anything but 800x600. Another downisde is the diplomacy, saying its is simple doesnt do it correctly, it is so bare that it hurts. Fortunately it doesnt need to be all that complicated. This is the last game before they made the 3D Rome Total War, another good game. It has a chess/boardgame feeling to it. I like it. This game is a load of fun, and good luck to anybody playing on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120489485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1545396483}
review:
I really, really like the game.
The gameplay etc is really good as pointed out in other reviews, but it just runs so embarrassingly bad on windows 10...
My gtx1050 gives me 4-12 fps and when I switch over to integrated graphics I get an average of 17 fps.
These low framerate on such an old game paired with the flickering of the loading screen and ramdomly going to my desktop is pretty damn frustrating.
I haven't found a working fix for these performance issues yet, but would love to be helped or even better
to see CA fixing the game itself. 

I would love to recommand this game, but I wouldn't want anybody bothering to deal with these issues when just wanting to play a solid TW

author: {'steamid': '76561198072450805', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 799, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1539299089}
review:
Jednym zdaniem: Medieval Total War to po Shogunie druga odsłona serii TW. Mało przełomowa, podobna do pierwszego Shoguna, ale z klimatem i akcją przeniesioną do średniowiecznej Europy, na bardziej swojskie dla nas podwórko. Po latach wciąż się broni. Choć nie jest tak świetna jak Rome i Medieval 2, to jest znacznie lepsza od wszystkich najnowszych odsłon TW. Tu silą jest przejrzystość, prostota, klimat i miodność rozgrywki. Niestety ten Medieval ma też kilka usterek... 

Plusy:

+ bardzo przejrzysty interfejs
+ ładnie narysowana mapa kampanii 
+ średniowieczna muzyka z klimatem
+ bitwy historyczne z Braveheart (Bannockburn i Stirling)
+ kilka historycznych kampanii w singlu
+ przyjemnie zrobiona walka
+ elementy polityki średniowiecznej
+ sporo nacji (jest też Polska)
+ historyczne wydarzenia 
+ po latach wciąż daje radę

Minusy:

- średnie intro
- trochę przestarzała grafika
- irytujące zapisywanie gry
- nie działające multi
- lekkie problemy ze sterowaniem jednostkami podczas walki 
- brak achievementów i kart kolekcjonerskich oraz Steam Cloud
- po jakimś czasie crashowanie gry na nowych systemach
- prawie martwa gra w multi https://steamcharts.com/app/345260

Komu polecam? / Komu odradzam?

+ polecam fanom starego Total War i kolekcjonerom serii
+ polecam graczom, którzy chcą zagrać Polską w średniowieczu
+ polecam miłośnikom filmu Waleczne serce ze względu na bitwy historyczne 
+ polecam wszystkim, którzy nie lubią niepotrzebnych graficznych fajerwerków
- odradzam graczom, którzy szukają bezproblemowej gry ze względu na crashe
- odradzam graczom, którzy mają już Medieval 2

Rada 1: 

Stareńki Medieval jest dobrym przykładem na to, jak należy robić interfejs i grafike na mapie strategicznej - tu aż przyjemnie się gra i buduje rózne rzeczy. Niech twórcy dzissiejszych rzeładowanych wodotryskami i cieniowaniem grafiki w nowych odsłonach TW przypomną sobie, jak kiedys się to robiło i zastosują tę lekcję w praktyce.

Rada 2:
 
Warto zainteresować się tym Medievalem, bo są tutaj bitwy historyczne z filmu Waleczne serce Mela Gibsona z 1995 roku. Warto je rozegrać samemu.

Rada 3: 

Medieval ma ewidentne problemy z crashami na nowych Windowsach, więc kupujecie na własne ryzyko.  

Podobne gry: Knights of Honor

==============================================
➥ Obserwuj mnie jako kuratora ⤵
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/10437106/

author: {'steamid': '76561198141390143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 26788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23072, 'last_played': 1594294438}
review: Gioco stupendo, è un peccato non si possano giocare fazioni come l'orda d'oro, un difetto è la troppa influenza del papato e la sua invincibilità, appena vieni scomunicato ti ritrovi le regioni in rivolta e nel peggiore dei casi una guerra civile, fastidioso anche il fatto che se viene sconfitto ritorni sempre con il triplo delle armate di prima, per il resto gioco consigliatissimo a chi non importa molto della grafica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027609614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 21609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1665501889}
review:
Short version: Buggy - Do Not Buy.

Been playing this for years on an old Windows XP machine, thought getting it to run under Steam was a great idea & was really enjoying the game...

But, after a couple of hours spent developing territory and building up armies, I only then discover it's as buggy as hell, and crashes when large armies are sent against each other.  Of course, you only find this out after it's too late to claim a refund for this piece of cynical recycling!

It's a shame, as it was a great game back in the day.  It's really put me off buying through steam, if they allow this sort of poor quality product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329277828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 183943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 97, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1712344900}
review:
As great as ever but infuriatingly buggy.

The combat hasn't lost much, although there's some blur over the units it isn't especially detrimental to the gameplay. Everything else ticks along as always and it's a classic of the genre but unfortunately there's a game-breaking bug. If at any time two full stacks of troops are moved into an area it crashes. A player can get around this by breaking their units up, not using Crusades, etc but the AI won't and it doesn't seem there's any way around it. Still worth buying but save often and try not to get boxed into a corner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024381549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1693, 'last_played': 1589944227}
review:
I had purchased this game years ago when it first came out, and will have racked up literal thousands of hours of play this is a phenominal game and has aged extremely well - you should get the very first game the original Shogun Total War as well. 

There is one issue however and that is with the game constantly crashing, I'm not sure exactly why but all you need do is turn off auto-save and that will fix it and I suspect it is simply because the game is so old there is most likely a compatibility issue somewhere in there, I've also changed the resolution from the default 800 x 600 (did I mention this is an old game?) to 1600 x 900 - the 1920 x 1080 just doesn't look right and makes everything look microscopic, as this was made when 800 x 600 was the standard resultion. 

So whether resultion was also a problem I'm not entirely sure, but definitely turn off auto-save and the game will/should run flawlessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003960877', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1654831729}
review:
I have loved this game for over 15 years!  Turn based strategy?  Medieval battles?  What's not to love?

Posting a fix for some folks having trouble with it - 
I was very frustrated recently when I got a new computer with Windows 10 and couldn't seem to run the game (Graphics Card Not Supported error).  I spent all day trying to figure out running in compatibility mode, trying to load it on a VM, running through a third-party application, no luck.

I ended up going to my graphics card settings and setting up a new resolution profile for 800x600, and setting the application to run in Windows Vista compatibility mode with 16 bit color (if I recall correctly)... That did the trick, it runs perfectly now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008025352', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1706355596}
review:
Total War:

Dieser Name legte Damals den Grundstein für sehr viele Folg Titel und mit Medieval Total War begann alles. Der Spieler wird in ein Mittelalterlisches Seting vesetzt wo er mit seinem Lieblingsvolk die Damal bekannt Welt erobern kann. Medieval ist ein Mix aus RPG und Aufbau auf Strategiekarten. Alerdings ist die Grafik ein Wenig Altbacken.

Ich gebe dem Game 4 von 5 Sternen aufgrund der Mittelmäßigen Grafik für Heutige Standarts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844398875', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1542006576}
review:
Very dissapointed

I've always been a huge fan of these games in particular the original however i do not recommend this game to anyone based on 2 reasons for those that don't want to waste time & money

1: The game crashes after 20 in game years during a campaign
2: Florins (in-game currency) are very hard to make and very hard to keep profit while defending/preparing to attack enemy factions - when i say very hard that's even an understatement the game is almost impossible

No fix for the crashes has been issued since the original post about the issue in 2015

Don't waste your time & money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040815791', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1573666745}
review:
I don't know how people say they can't get this to run in Windows 10. Just need to make sure that you increase the resolution in game to whatever your desktop resolution is. 

The best thing about the older total wars is that the campaign AI isn't pants on head retarded (this is in part because the AI can't handle the 3D style campaign map properly in the newer games. The older Risk style campaign map, they had less decisions to make, so the decisions they did make were smarter). The battle AI isn't amazing, but it does the job, just make sure to play on hard at the least.

Graphically, it's not winning any awards, but it's consistent and personally I find it quite charming. Because there isn't hyper detail, it leaves more to your imagination. 

Basically give it a try, it's fun. Also, there's a Westeros/Game of Thrones mod that was made for it recently as well that is quite well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139141600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1572006128}
review:
Klasyka, miło wrócić do tego tytułu po kilkunastu latach. Grafika na polu bitewnym jest oczywiście bardzo przestarzała, ale nie sprawia to większego kłopotu. Podobnie jak wielu innych na tym forum miałem problem z grą na Windows 8 - wyrzucało mnie zawsze w 1151 roku. Udało mi się to naprawić poprzez zmianę rozdzielczości z 800x600 na 1024x768 - po tym gra chodziła bez problemu. Nie wiem, czy u wszystkich to pomoże, ale spróbować warto.

Polecam

author: {'steamid': '76561198026722388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1680733414}
review:
[h1]Technical note:[/h1] People are complaining about this game not running in Windows 10. I have W10 x64, with two monitors, primary using Radeon card and secondary using in-chip video. The game runs without any problem following this recommendation [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MyhqnPsaKKI] HERE [/url]. As I said, not a single problem or crash despite I am running mods, not vanilla game.

[h1]Verdict: Extremely subjective[/h1]

[h1]Battlefield tactician: 9.5/10[/h1] Hands down the best battles in the Total War series.
[h1]Grand strategist: 6.5/10[/h1] Campaign mechanics are outdated, but they still deliver.
[h1]Graphics fetishists: 1/10[/h1] Better look somewhere else, game is reaaaally outdated in this area.

[h1]PrivateJoh’s personal (re)view:[/h1]
Yes, [i]Medieval Total War: Viking Invasion[/i] is really outdated in the graphics and mechanics departments. But, who cares?

Don’t let my Steam playtime fool you. I have played countless hours, both vanilla and moded versions of the game. And I think it can hold its own against vanilla and even moded Rome and Medieval 2 (which in my opinion are way superior to later franchise offers).  

What does [i]Medieval Total War: Viking Invasion[/i] have to offer? Basically, the best battle tactics of the series. It is seriously good. Maneuvering your troops is actually possible in order to obtain battlefield superiority. Real good. On the other hand, bridge battles as chokepoints can get old fast.

What is [i]Medieval Total War: Viking Invasion[/i] lacking? Apart from the visual aspect, the campaign mechanics are outdated. It boosts a Risk type map, poor diplomatic options and a very simplistic commerce model. 

Ah, and don’t you forget about community mods. They are a blast to play. They expand the game to quality and challenge levels that are difficult to imagine. Redux, XL, Pike and musket, NTW, … Check them and some others [url=http://www.twcenter.net/forums/forumdisplay.php?1922-Medieval-Modifications] HERE [/url]. 

[b]In summary:[/b] at 2€ when on sale, [i]Medieval Total War: Viking Invasion[/i] is a gem for battlefield tacticians that can live with outdated graphics and game mechanics. Mods will extent the fun a loooooong time.

For more PrivateJoh’s personal (re)views you can check [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32042143-PrivateJoh%27s-personal-%28re%29views/] HERE [/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198044418183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2024, 'last_played': 1703499987}
review: Забудьте про Римы и Ваху! Вот игра для настоящих мужиков! Суровая графа, суровый ИИ, здесь все сурово! Лучшая часть серии Total War.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178572853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1628449741}
review:
Moim zdaniem jedna z najbardzie klimatycznych gier z sierii Total War. Może nie jest aż tak rozbudoowana jak nowsze części, ale potrafi wciągnąć na długie godziny. Twórcy zamieścili w grze kilka fajnych pomysłów np. jak podział królestwa, gdy w armii wstępują nielojalni generałowie, dużo historycznych wydarzeń czy zwięcstwo przez wypełnianie konkretnych celów.

Co do edycji Steam niestety u mnie występuję błąd na mapie kampanii. Po kliknięciu na kartę jednostki wywala do puplitu. Grę kupiłem na aktualnej promocji za 9zł, ale w standardowej cenie 35zł radzę się zastanowić bo gra głupieje na nowszych systemach. Jest to loteria, bo np. pierwszy Shogun działa u mnie bez zarzutu, a jest bardziej leciwy.

Podsumowując pierwszy MTW to czysta klasyka, dla fana staroci lub osób pałających sentymentem do starszych odsłon serii Total War. 

Samą grę oceniam bardzo pozytywnie (długi godziny przegrane w wersję pudełkową) natomiast edycja Steam powinna być przystosowana do nowych systemów, bo gra zwyczajnie nie działa...Jakoś GOG potrafi dostosować stare gry do nowych systemów.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046400918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 31233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18665, 'last_played': 1703185617}
review:
This was my first game that I played in the Total War Series and thanks to that I'm still playing these games. A big improve against the Shogun Total War. First you have more factions and units to play. There is a difference between every nation that adds replay value to play with every faction in the game. You are playing in Medieval times in different eras, at first more melee (spears, words, cavalry) and then more gunpowder units (muskets, canons, etc). 
I loved it, it is a very great game with strategy between playing as a Christian or Muslim or playing as Spain or Poland.
I recomend a lot this game, it keeps a basic gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037301785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1711151857}
review: This game has dated graphics in the battles but in the champain map its fine. The batle graphics can be easily overlooked. You will never have the cool looking battles of later total wars but battles but they are still fun. I actually like this one more than most of the tatw games especially the later ones. Its building tree is more complex. Most buildings need other buildings to be built for them to be usefull. for example horse breeders  by themselves don't make cave exept in a few circumstances. You would have to make a royal court with it and it will produce knights. This makes the building aspect of the game more fun and strategic. Its cheap so if u liked some of the total war games i recomend it, you will have fun on it. I don't know if it has multiplayer battles but i know it doesn't have multiplayer campain. Also I know it works on windows 10, it works fine as far as i can tell. rome total war seems to be sped up but this one is fine. I rate it a 85/100.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316012865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2622, 'last_played': 1705164500}
review:
IL Total War.
Sarà stato sballato storicamente, inesatto sotto tutti i punti di vista, buggato con il finale assurdo e troppo facile, MA...
La parte gestionale non è semplice come i giochi attuali, soprattutto non è scontata e spesso ci si trova a fare i conti con linee di riferimenti troppo lunghe che rallentano l'avanzata di armate.

Questo è l'unico Total War in cui ci si può trovare davani un'IA che sa cosa sta facendo: nell'end game capita di solito di avere contro un altro blocco nazionale spesso forte quanto il giocatore se non di più.

Le battaglie non saranno coreografiche come quelle di Attila o Shogun 2, ma sono realistiche e la cavalleria caricherà le lance o le picche solo come ultima risorsa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154715016', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 139349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 87, 'playtime_at_review': 25210, 'last_played': 1712231089}
review:
Gioco strepitoso.... mi commuovo.... Ma ora farò la recensione VERA e COMPLETA di ciò che penso su questo gioco. Innanzitutto, non è stato ottimizzato molto bene per i nuovi sistemi operativi come Win 8 o Win 10, ma c'è una soluzione, leggete bene:

Dovete settare il gioco in modalità compatibilità Windows XP, su proprietà! Inoltre quando siete in gioco impostate la stessa risoluzione sia per le battaglie che per la campagna, ricordando che non sia MAI 800x600 altrimenti a quella risoluzione crasha spesso!

Se avete una scheda NVIDIA con i driver aggiornati, non dovrebbe darvi problemi ( ho una GTX 1050Ti con i7 7770k e win 10 64 bit), e mi va alla grande!

Girate questo messaggio ai vostri amici, specie se ci tenete tanto a rigiocarci, è un gioco molto vecchio, datato in grafica, diplomazia e meccaniche... ma nella sua semplicità è anche molto complesso, inoltrando elementi assai realistici, medievali, gotici che nemmeno il buon ( sempre eccezionale, sia chiaro) Medieval 2 non ha mai introdotto, nemmeno coi mods! Medieval Total War è un simulatore di guerra, con poche opzioni al livello di diplomazia, ma tante dal punto di vista dell' amministrazione e nella gestione delle provincie ( ci sono tantissime strutture da poter costruire), ogni unità è comandata da un generale vero e unico, che può avere delle stelle di comando, la lealtà verso il monarca, il terrore che i nemici e la popolazione incute verso di esso, e ovviamente il livello di Pietà ( o fanatismo religioso). Ogni caratteristica presenterà delle conseguenze negli eventi e nel intercalare del gioco, positive o negative! Crociate, inquisizioni, guerre civili, fazioni annientate che riemergono dalle ceneri, atmosfera gotica e medievale immensa, battaglie lunghe e avvincenti ( quando ho affrontato i mongoli ho perso 3 ore per una battaglia, e ho ucciso il Khan con una cannonata, di classe!)

Le meccaniche saranno obsolete, ma sono molto affascinanti e vi terranno incollati allo schermo per minimo 6 mesi, a tutti coloro a cui ho mostrato questo gioco gli è piaciuto tantissimo e ci giocano ancora oggi ( la maggior parte), da provare assolutamente!

Il papa è un vero e proprio antagonista, OBBEDITELO o vi scomunicherà maledicendovi in eterno, mandandoti tutto il mondo cattolico addosso, e sarà molto difficile contenerli tutti assieme ( ovviamente con una fazione cattolica, se comandate i bizantini o le fazioni islamiche ovviamente non avete il papa a rompere ed è un pregio).


L'interfaccia è datata, ma facilmente accessibile per i neofiti, è molto facile identificare gli eredi al trono o gli agenti (preti, vescovi, cardinali, assasini, spie, inquisitori, imam ecc.), con uno click si fa tutto! 

Le crociate sono realizzate molto bene, e risultano tutt'ora, tra le parti più divertenti di Medieval I, così come le Jihad per le fazioni islamiche. La differenza sta nel fatto che la Jihad può solamente riportare indietro territori islamici prima persi, ma non a conquistarne di nuovi ( a differenza della crociata che, ovvio, può farlo)

Il sistema del commercio è molto simpatico, anche se un pò irritante, considerando che dovrete avere un sistema di navi lungo tutte le coste che colleghino tutte le provincie/regioni permettendo entrate commerciali, altrimenti, la rotta risulterà compromessa nell'avvenire, e non è una cosa molto bella per le casse del vostro regno, quindi bisogna prestare attenzione quando si muovono le flotte, per quanto riguarda le battaglie navali come nel secondo capitolo, sono sempre in automatico. (Eh già, c'era da aspettarselo d'altronde).

Gli eventi in questo gioco influiscono sull' andamento delle provincie e di ciò che succede sulla mappa di campagna, ad esempio la Crociata contadina aumenterà lo zelo ( il fanatismo religioso) inducendo più gente dalla provincia a unirsi alla crociata, ecc. Insomma, in questo gioco, ogni piccolo evento storico ha un suo perché e delle sue conseguenze.

Un grave problema di questo gioco è il sistema della risoluzione automatica, abbastanza sbilanciato ( sopratutto giocando a livelli di difficoltà elevata), perciò consiglio di combattere tutte le battaglie manualmente, L'IA è abbastanza competente in questo gioco ( a differenza dei più recenti capitoli), in quanto la mappa stile risiko pur contando meno dettagli nel terreno e quindi meno cose da considerare, quelle cose che c'erano le faceva meglio, offrendo più astuzia nelle tattiche di battaglia.

A proposito di tattiche, l'intelligenza artificiale non è tutto-rush come negli ultimi giochi, dovea prescindere dalla composizione delle armate tende sempre a camperare o attaccare in massa senza una strategia precisa... ebbene nel primo Medieval fortunatamente non è così!

L'IA qui si nasconde nei boschi, cerca di schermagliare, di stuzzicare e di sorprendere con imboscate o attacchi nei punti più letali della formazione nemica, e tante altre cose che vedrete giocandoci! E' molto imprevedibile l'IA di MTW 1!

Questo è l'unico TW in cui i Ribelli possono risultare in una vera e propria minaccia, sono molto più vasti e ricchi di quanto lo siano in MTW2, ti mandano contro armate grosse, molto pericolose... senza contare che talvolta possono anche invadervi!

I controlli in battaglia non sono tra i migliori, e sono invecchiati male, vi consiglio di combattere e di muovere le truppe con i comandi premendo col tasto del mouse sulle unità ( e CTRL per selezionare più gruppi, come anche da Rome in poi).

Questo è stato il primo Total War ad introdurre i tratti per i generali, con i vizi e virtù ( ognuna delle quali offrirà vantaggi e svantaggi per la provincia in cui il generale o meglio dire "governatore" controlla/ detiene).

La diplomazia è molto semplice e intuitiva, a parte guerra, pace, tregua, corruzione, alleanza e matrimonio dinastico ( con il quale puoi cercare eredi di fazioni che possano sposarsi con le tue principesse o viceversa), insomma.. non molte cose. Ma qual poco che hanno fatto è stato fatto con cura, le alleanze inoltre sono durature, ed è raro che un alleato ti vada a tradire considerando che se invadete un alleato ( o voi o il computer), avrete un enorme penalità nell'ordine pubblico delle provincie, dove la popolazione impazzirà in tutto l'impero quindi, mi raccomando, fate molta attenzione a non tradire gli alleati, in questo gioco sono cose molto importanti.

L'artwork, le musiche, la mappa risiko, le sfumature, i ritratti, le descrizioni, gli eventi... tutto è fatto con amore e passione. Se volete un gioco old-school, datato, ma intrigante, appassionante e atmosferico, allora Medieval Total War fa per voi! Ci sono ben 170 unità, diversi agenti, centinaia di strutture da costruire e molte fazioni ( includendo anche la campagna vichinga, inclusa assieme a quella medievale). 


Il mio giudizio:

GRAFICA: 3/10 ( Sì, quella fa veramente acqua da tutte le parti)

MUSICA/SONORO: 10/10 ( Miglior colonna sonora forse dell' intera saga)

ATMOSFERA: 10/10 ( Oscura e terrificante, l'epoca buia nella sua eccellenza)

GAMEPLAY: 9/10 (Ha i suoi difetti, come i castelli piccoli che sembrano delle scatole e potrà risultare un pò vecchiotto, ma offre una giocabilità  alla pari dei Total War successivi, riesce a tenerli testa su questo campo, e su certi aspetti addirittura li supera)

CONTROLLI: 4/10 ( Ehm, dovrete abituarvi perché sono invecchiati male)


MTW è una pietra miliare assoluta dello strategico a turni, dalla quale molti giochi hanno attinto, compreso il successore Medieval 2 (il quale tutto sommato ritengo il gioco migliore tra i due, grazie anche alle infinite mod, ma questa è un altra storia).



Spero di essere stato esauriente :)

Divertitevi!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087504351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1586260147}
review:
An absolutely fantastic game. Perhaps with the nostaglic spectacles on, but still a nice little piece of RTS history. The darker tone is much more appealing with the barbaric times it portrays, especially in comparison with its equally addictive but cartoony successor MTW:II.

However, unfortunately with great disappointment I must say this game simple refuses to function on more modern machines in spite of many attempts to get it work (for this incarnation the logged time to my account is simply registered crashes and the game refusing to load up). 

Maybe you will be more fortunate and be able to either experience this gem of RTS for the first time, or sink many more hours into the malaise of medieval europe as you conquer all in your path. That or prematurely bald as you struggle to get the game to function. 

If any souls out there know of a way in which I may bask in the glorious light of this game's good grace then please inform a weary traveller.

 God Wills It!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050656125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 18983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8467, 'last_played': 1671635035}
review:
Эталон с большой буквы для всей серии. Ни одна часть меня так не впечатлила, как эта. Старая, но не бесполезная Medieval: Total War раскрывает весь *потанцевал* стратегии как в бою, так и на карте. Как и куда, по какой цене и зачем становится понятно прямо из коробки - простой и дружелюбный интерфейс, чего не скажешь про другие части. Легко управлять отрядами в бою, войска не *пластилиновые*, в отличии от собратьев и ими можно манипулировать без гемороя в заднице. 

К минусам можно отнести автоматический бой и бесполезность дипломатии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169560446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 77050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2668, 'last_played': 1665687450}
review: A really great title! One of the best if not the best title of the Total War game series. Medieval europe is always a good period in which You can put games and it suits this sereies very well. It's true that graphics of battles have aged with the passing time, but battles are still satisfying and the campaign on the map is great. In addition, I recommend to take interest in mods: Redux or XL for people who have already played this title and are looking for a variety (difficulty level, units, factions, etc ...). I really recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067402505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1551976386}
review: Çocukluğumun , adam akıllı strateji tarih oyunlarını sevdiren simülasyonun ilk vakti :'( Buglar çözülse genel manada çok hoş...   MTW2 1.3 de pislik yaptılar Osmanlıya vs. 1.51 de düzeltiler. Empire total war ve Napoleon zaten korkunç! Hiç gerçeğe uymayan askeri güçsüzlük vardı ki Osmanlı tek başına savaşıp yediyordu 18.yy da dahi... Avusturya ve Rusyayı bile tek başına yenmişti... MTW 1'in Müzikleri muhteşem! Anladığım kadarıyla Türklerin ve Müslümanların askerleride hakettiği gibi çok güçlü... Zaten Yeniçeriler en iyi birliklerdi döneminin... Az asker ile çok sayıda haçlıları kaç kez püskürttük. Ben çocukken viking paketi çıkmadan 2 farklı uzun mızraklı birliği vardı oyunda, çok güçlüydüler malesef vikingde birini sildiler , şimdi ikincisinide silmişler galiba :'( Viking öncesinde çok taktik yapabiliyorduk askerler uzun süre savaşıyordu , şimdi MTW2 dekinden bile hızlı öldürüyorlar birbirlerini :/ Bide Heavy Yeniçeriyi çok pahalı yapmışlar. Ama muhteşem oyun. Campingteki liderlin resimleri MTW2 ve diğerlerinden çok daha gerçekçi ve isyanla yeni devlet kurulabiliyordu MTW2 aksine......... MTW3 gelsin ve diğerleri gibi şerefsizlik yapmasalar çok hoş olacak :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197985409325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1516824833}
review:
Medieval: Total War consists of two parts: 1. strategy map where you can improve your settlements, train soldiers and move your armies and 2. the battlefield where you need to command your troops. The second part is entirely optional if you wish so since battles can be auto-resolved, too. That is a good thing because the biggest weakness Medieval 1 has is that the battlefield is not fun. 

[b]pros[/b]
+ huge strategy map
+ many playable factions
+ many units, buildings and improvements
+ faction commanders have a variety of skills they can learn

[b]cons[/b]
- 2D strategy map and units
- fighting on the battlefield is not fun
- It takes too long to train good units
- UI could be more helpful
- feels dated in comparison to Medieval II

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
The battlefield is the weakest link this game has and makes the game feel dated. If you don't mind dated battles or just want to auto-resolve yourself to victory, this game might be for you. For everyone else: Medieval II is the best game in the series for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162675789', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1629925173}
review:
[list]
    [*]У Вас имеется склонность к стратегическому планированию в играх на 10-20-30 действий вперед?
    [*]Вы обожаете пошаговые стратегии?
    [*]Вы интересуетесь историческими играми?
    [*]Или вы просто как и я ностальгируете по временам беззаботной юности, когда сыграть продолжительную партию за компьютером соседа было большой удачей?
[/list]
Тогда вы попали по адресу. Родоначальница семейства Medieval, заложившая и утвердившая многие каноны пошаговых игр. Стала органичным продолжением прародитея серии Shogun.
Игра великолепно адаптирована под современные машины, что избавит Вас от необходимости в танцах, бубнах и ритаульных жертвоприношениях.
[spoiler]Категорически не рекомендуется искателям фотореалистичной графики и пышных спецэффектов. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047342170', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1704460793}
review:
For me it's undoubtedly the best TW game (among STW, MTW1/2 and RTW).

It's just flawless. You can play it for many years, especially if you stick to some Homerules (like changing your faction each time the current king dies).

The only disadvantages in comparison with RTW/MTW2:

* no such thing as population in cities

* not possible to place units on castle walls

author: {'steamid': '76561198020395175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1509607468}
review:
Love this game. I still think it's the best of the whole series, only the first Rome version is close to matching it. 

Functionality: Running it on win 7 pro. Switched resolution on desktop down from 4k to 1024x768, then run MTW. In game vid options, moved it up to 1920x1080 on all screens. Works fine, never crashes. 

pros: -Great Game, Great music, seems improved on AI. Playing Hard/Hard was actually hard, where I used to slam the AI in the old days. Might be viking age improvements (but I prefer full map games).

cons: Graphics kind of suck. Interface is a little too one-button mouse oriented, and you have to unlearn more modern instincts. For example, to make a group in tactical combat you don't hit ctrl-1, just group and hit 1.

Summary: you are buying a 15 year old game. If you are willing to deal with that, it's an excellent experience.
